title: shirogane_naoto
body:
One of the main characters of [[Persona 4]]. An accomplished detective.

Naoto is [[androgynous]] in appearance, with [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] and [[grey eyes]] ([[blue eyes|blue]] in The Animation and Arena). She wears [[yasogami school uniform|Yasogami High's]] [[gakuran]]. Naoto is often seen wearing formal clothing such as blue shirts, ties, and her trademark blue [[cabbie hat|cap]]. She [[reverse trap|crossdresses]] to hide her true gender and her [[large breasts]].

Her Persona are [[Sukuna-Hikona (Persona 4)|]], [[Yamato Takeru (Persona)|]] and Yamato Sumeragi of The Fortune arcana.

Voiced by: [[Paku Romi]] (Japanese), Anna Graves (English, PS2 release, [[Persona 4 The Golden|Golden]], [[Persona 4: The Ultimate in Mayonaka Arena|Arena]]), [[Mary Elizabeth McGlynn]] (English, [[Persona 4 The Animation|The Animation]]), Valerie Arem (English, all other appearances)

title: shoukaku_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Shoukaku[/i]. 
Character design by [[Enka (bcat)]], voiced by [[Taneda Risa]].

Her appearance is strikingly similar to [[Shoukaku (kancolle)|]] from [[Kantai Collection]], with the only major differences being her [[blue eyes]] and her [[white hair]] being done [[one side up]] while swapping out the hairband for a red spider lily. The sleeves to her outfit are elongated, however, meant to bear a resemblance to her namesake bird. 

While similar in ladylike design and apparently polite personality with her [[Shoukaku (kancolle)|Kancolle counterpart]], Azur Lane's Shoukaku is far more jaded and sarcastic, looking down upon her seniors and considering them fools for their failure at the Battle of Midway. In spite of her caustic attitude towards her "sempais", she does dote on her sister [[zuikaku_(azur_lane)|Zuikaku]] and the [[commander_(azur_lane)|Commander]].


h4. Appearance

title: ookami_mio_(hololive_summer_2019)
body:
The original [[bikini]] [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Ookami Mio]], first featured in the [i][[hololive]] Idol Project 2019 Summer[/i]. While initially not having a name, the swimsuit was given the name [i]Summer Vacation[/i] in the [i][[Azur Lane]][/i] collab on late 2019 as a limited-time skin.

It consist of a [[two-sided jacket|two-sided]] [[black jacket|black]] [[hooded jacket]] worn over a [[white bikini|white]] [[front-tie bikini top|front-tie]] [[bikini]] with a [[leaf print|leaf]] [[print bikini|print]] and a [[side-tie bikini bottom]], [[white shorts|white]] [[short shorts|shorts]] [[side slit shorts]], a black [[thigh strap]] and black [[high heels|high-heel]] [[sandals]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this swimsuit is [[very long hair]] tied into a [[wide ponytail]] with [[sidelocks]] and decorated with her usual eye glint [[hairclip]].

title: deep_bond_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]His name is a combination of his sire and grandsire's names. ([b]Deep[/b] Impact + Kizuna [b]"Bond"[/b]) [/tn]

Japanese race [[horse]]. Sired by Kizuna and foaled by Zephyranthes (by [[King Halo (racehorse)|]]). He is a brown horse with no leg markings and a large star facial marking. He is of the same owner as [[Contrail (racehorse)|]] as well as his contemporary.

He is infamous for ironically being a slow-natured horse. His "PuBo" nickname is also an expression of his slow nature[tn][i]-pubo[/i][/tn]. He also has another "Mo-i" nickname derived from a cry the horse allegedly made on camera, which was instantly picked up by the Internet for the cry being so un-horse-like (the "cry's" actual source is disputed).

He also happens to be Japan's racehorse with the highest earnings without any G1 wins, thanks to his 4 consecutive podium finishes at the Spring Tenno-sho (finishing 2nd, 2nd, 2nd and 3rd). While he surpasses [[Nice Nature (racehorse)|]] in earnings, races in the 2020's give significantly more earnings than races in the 1990's and Nice Nature ran more races in general. Deep Bond retired after the 2024 [[Arima Kinen]] and will become a leading horse at Kyoto Racecourse.

h5. Related
* [[Wada Ryuji]] - Main jockey
* [[Miyuki Hideaki]] - Main jockey, succeeded Wada

title: olivier_peslier
body:
[[Real life]] French [[jockey]]. Most notably, he is the 4 time winner of the Prix l'Arc de Triomphe. He also was a successful foreign jockey in Japan, predating [[Mirco Demuro]] and [[Christophe Lemaire]], having won a number of Grade 1 races while riding under a limited time license (短期免許).

Peslier retired on April 25, 2024.

body:

body:
An unnamed mermaid from [i][[Donkey Kong 64]][/i]. Found in the fourth world, Gloomy Galleon, she asks [[Tiny Kong]] for help to retrieve her stolen pearls from the Kremlings.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]] and sports [[large breasts]]. She wears [[blue eyeshadow]], a [[silver tiara]], a [[pendant]] and a blue [[shell_bikini|seashelled bikini]].  

Her character model is later reused in [i][[Banjo-Tooie]][/i] as decrepit statues in the Atlantis portion of Jolly Roger Lagoon

body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Minato Aqua]].

It's based on a [[serafuku]] and consists of a [[white shirt|white]] short-sleeved [[sailor shirt]] with a [[blue sailor collar|blue]] [[frilled sailor collar]] , a [[blue choker|blue]] [[ribbon choker]], a [[blue bowtie]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[suspender skirt|suspender]] [[miniskirt]], reaching [[underbust|under her bust]], a [[white jacket|white]] [[hooded jacket|hooded]] [[open jacket]] with a [[cat hood]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[white pantyhose]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]], she also now has [[cat ears]] and a [[cat tail]] with a [[tail ribbon]], she sometimes wears a [[blue hat|blue]] [[baseball cap]] [[hat under hood|under her hood]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official ahairstyles]] in this costume
* [[Long hair]] tied in [[twin braids]] and a [[blue hairband]] or a [[bow hairband]] with an [[anchor hair ornament]]

body: Kendra is an antagonist in [[Rick and Morty]]. Serving as the main antagonist of the episode Gotron Jerrysis Rickvangelion.

title: karen_(class_of_09)
body:
A character in [[class of 09|Class of '09]] and its sequels. 

A nerdy girl who enjoys reading and photography. Despite being ignorant to the various amoral topics covered in the visual novel, she is often seen as the most "normal" character in the cast due to her lack of negative traits.

title: lynn_hadley
body:
A character in [[class of 09|Class of '09]] and its sequels. 

She is the rather apathetic principal of the high school the visual novel is set in, as she cares very little for her students, as well as refusing to take action against the various immoral traits harbored within the faculty.

title: nicole's_mother_(class_of_09)
body:
A character in [[class of 09|Class of '09]] and its sequels. 

She is the mother of both [[Nicole (class of 09)|]] and Gamer Brother (nickname given by Nicole; his real name unknown).

title: kelly_(class_of_09)
body:
A character in [[class of 09|Class of '09]] and its sequels. 

Kelly is an extroverted and lively girl, who usually gets along with a majority of the cast, unless she is threatened or insulted. She works as the part-time manger of the FYE at the local mall, in which she takes her job very seriously, as seen in some routes.

title: ari_(class_of_09)
body:
A character in [[class of 09|Class of '09]] and its sequels. She becomes the deuteragonist for some of the routes featured in [b]The Re 'Up[/b].

Ari is a timid and reserved girl who struggles with various issues such as self-harm, depression, and her closeted feelings towards other girls, stemming from her fears of her orientation being known by the school. In some routes, she can enter a rather unhealthy relationship with [[Nicole (class of 09)|]].

title: aleste
body:
A series of popular [[science fiction]] shooting [[video game]]s by [[Compile]].

The [b]Aleste[/b] franchise started in the 80s with the first game of the same name released for the [[Sega Master System]] as [b]Power Strike[/b] in 1988.

They usually feature (an) attractive ace female pilot(s) riding a flying combat [[mecha]] or a [[starfighter]].

h4.Notable titles

* [[MUSHA Aleste]]
* [[GG Aleste]]
* [[Super Aleste]]
* [[Dennin Aleste]]
* [[GG Aleste II]]
* [[Power Strike II]]
* [[GG Aleste 3]]
* [[Senjin Aleste]]

h4. Notable characters

* [[Ellinor Weisen]]
* [[Luna Waizen]]

title: byalant_isolde
body:

A variant of the RX-160 [[Byalant]] piloted by [[Walter Fermo]] and affiliated to the [[Birnam]] PMC.

title: birnam
body:

[b]Birnam[/b] is a Private Military Company.

title: gundam_tristan
body:
A fictional manned giant robot form the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It was first introduced in the Novel/ONA series [[gundam:_twilight_axis|Mobile Suit Gundam Twilight Axis]] from 2017.

[b]RX-78AN-01 Gundam AN-01 "Tristan"[/b]

A [[mobile suit]] developed from the combination of several parts from previous Gundam models, mostly the old [[Gundam Alex]]. It is affiliated to the [[Birnam]] private army.

title: bleach
body:
A very popular long running shounen manga and anime series by [[Kubo Tite]]. 

The story revolves around [[Kurosaki Ichigo]], a young man who became a [[shinigami]] after his encounter with [[Kuchiki Rukia]] and his adventure into the afterlife and beyond.

h4. Sagas

In roughly chronological order:

* [[Bleach: Turn Back the Pendulum|Turn Back the Pendulum]]
* [[Bleach: Memories of Nobody|Memories of Nobody]] (filler)
* [[Bleach: Zanpakutou Ibun Hen|Zanpakutou Ibun Hen]] (filler)
* [[bleach: sennen kessen-hen|The Thousand-Year Blood War]]
* [[Bleach: Epilogue|Epilogue]]

h4. Objects / Clothes / Symbols

* [[Fukutaichou badge]]
* [[Taichou haori]]
* [[Shihouin symbol]]
* [[Shinigami daikou symbol]]

h4. Powers / Power-ups

* [[Shikai]]
* [[Bankai]]
* [[Resurreccion]]
* [[Garganta]]

h4. Creatures / Races

title: emd_sd40-2
body: A 6-axle, 3,000 horsepower (2,240 kilowatt) [[Diesel Locomotive| Diesel]] [[locomotive]] developed by General Motors' Electro-Motive Division (GM EMD) for the North American market in the early 1970s, the SD40-2 is one of the company's most successful products. Nearly 4,000 units would be produced for North American railroads across a 17-year period.

title: jr_west_223_series
body:
The 223 series (223系, 223-kei) is a suburban electric multiple unit (EMU) train type operated by the [[West Japan Railway Company]] (JR-West) in the Kansai region, Chūgoku region and Shikoku region of Japan. Multiple batches of the model have been built with varying differences (particularly motor output control), although the overall general appearance remains similar.

h4. Examples 

* !asset #23073379: 223-0
* !asset #23073447: 223-0 (renewed lights and with safety fence)
* !asset #23073436: 223-1000 (with safety fence)
* !asset #23073395: 223-2000 (with safety fence)

h4. See also

* [[Japan Railways]]
** [[West Japan Railway Company]]
* [[Multiple Unit Train]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: 223 Series":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/223_series

title: ayamy_(vtuber)
body:
[[Ayamy]]'s [[virtual YouTuber]] persona. 

h4. Appearance
[tn]See post #4157867.[/tn]

In her VTuber form, she is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with a [[side ponytail]] to her left, and [[blue eyes]].

Her default outfit consists of a pink [[hair bow]], [[cat hair ornament]]s holding her ponytail, an [[x hair ornament]] to her right, and an orange-white [[hoodie]] with a paw print attachment on the pocket side.

Her second outfit (post #4536944) has her don [[twintails]] and a [[maid headdress]] hair bow, while she now sports a [[bare shoulders|bare-shoulder]] [[black dress]] with purple [[bow]]s and [[frills]], frilled [[wrist cuffs]], [[pantyhose]], and black [[loafers]].

title: yangchen_(avatar)
body:
A character from the [[Avatar Legends]] franchise.

She was one of the previous incarnations of the Avatar, a powerful being who can control all four elements. She was an [[aerokinesis|Airbender]] who succeeded Avatar [[Szeto (Avatar)|]] and preceded Avatar [[Kuruk (Avatar)|]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with bare forehead and wears an [[orange jacket]] over a [[yellow dress]].

title: prefect_team_(blue_archive)
body:
In [[Blue Archive]], the Prefect Team is one of the School Clubs at Gehenna Academy.

The Prefect Team is responsible for disciplinary actions and general policing of the Gehenna Academy student body, as well as being a functional army. Frequently clashes with the Pandemonium Society.

Being a faction tag, this should only be used when all members of the group are present and equally in focus.

h4. Members

* [[Hina (blue archive)|]]
* [[Ako (blue archive)|]]
* [[Iori (blue archive)|]]
* [[Chinatsu (blue archive)|]]
other_names: 風紀委員会(ブルーアーカイブ)

title: fang_(avatar)
body: Avatar [[Roku (Avatar)|]]'s dragon.

title: kuruk_(avatar)
body:
A character from the [[Avatar Legends]] franchise.

He was one of the previous incarnations of the Avatar, a powerful being who can control all four elements. He was a [[hydrokinesis|Waterbender]] who succeeded Avatar [[Yangchen (Avatar)|]] and preceded Avatar [[Kyoshi (Avatar)|]], [[Roku (Avatar)|]], and [[Aang]].

He has [[dark skin]], [[brown hair]], and wears a [[polar bear]] [[pelt]].

title: kyoshi_(avatar)
body:
A character from the [[Avatar Legends]] franchise.

She was one of the previous incarnations of the Avatar, a powerful being who can control all four elements. She was an [[geokinesis|Earthbender]]  who succeeded Avatar [[Kuruk (Avatar)|]] and preceded Avatar [[Roku (Avatar)|]] and [[Aang]].

She has [[long hair|long]], [[brown hair]] and wears [[makeup]] resembling the kind seen in [[Peking opera]]. She also wears a golden [[headdress]], a [[green kimono]], and often [[dual wielding|dual wields]] [[folding fan]]s. She was known to be very tall and very longlived, reaching the age of 230.

title: hug_from_behind
body:
Indicates one character is [[front-to-back]] with another character and [[hug]]s them from behind.

Do not confuse with [[Grabbing from behind]].

title: ozai
body:
The main antagonist in [[Avatar: The Last Airbender]]. He is the Fire Lord, the ruler of the Fire Nation whose goal is to conquer the other nations of the world.

He is the father to [[Zuko|Prince Zuko]] and brother of [[Iroh]]. He has [[yellow eyes]], [[long air|long]] [[black hair]] and a narrow [[beard]].

title: iroh
body:
A character in [[Avatar: The Last Airbender]]. He is the brother of Fire Lord [[Ozai]] and uncle of Prince [[Zuko]]. He accompanied Zuko during the latter's exile and quest to find the Avatar.

He is a fat, elderly man with [[grey hair|grey]] [[mutton chops]] and a [[beard]].

title: list_of_yume_nikki_fangames
body:
[[Yume_nikki|Yume Nikki]] inspired a large number of fangames. For the full list, click the link to fangames wikia below.


Tags with ten or more posts are in [b]bold[/b]. 
Tags with fifty or more posts are in [b][i]bold and italic[/i][/b].

h4. List of fangames:
* [b][i][[Yume 2kki]][/i][/b]

title: nice_nature_(racehorse)
body:
Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by Nice Dancer and foaled by Urakawa Miyuki.

Nice Nature was Japan's most successful racehorse to not have won any G1 races. ([[Deep Bond (racehorse)|]] surpassed his earnings but only in [i]2023[/i], with all the earnings inflation that entails.  Nice Nature last raced in [i]1996[/i]. [[Stay Gold (racehorse)|]] actually surpassed him before his only G1 win in 2001.) His most notable feat is finishing 3rd in three consecutive [[arima kinen|Arima Kinens]], earning him the nickname of "Bronze Collector" and giving him the popularity of an underdog.

His modern day relevance, aside from being the model for [i][[Umamusume]][/i]'s [[Nice Nature (umamusume)|]], which did gave him renewed popularity, is his tremendous longevity for a thoroughbred horse. Born on April 16 1988, he passed away on May 30 2023. He lived to the ripe old age of 35 years and 44 days, making him JRA's 4th oldest graded winner.

He was a bay horse with no markings. In his racing prime, he often raced with his signature red and green hood emblazoned with his name or his initials.

h4. See Also
* [[Baba Hideki]] - Nice Nature's groom

title: n'ex
body:
The Narita Express, abbreviated as N'EX, is a limited express [[train]] service operated by [[East Japan Railway Company]] between [[Narita Airport]] and [[Tokyo station]] via [[Chiba (city)|]], with through services to services to Ofuna, Takao, and Omiya via major stations such as Yokohama, Shinagawa, [[shibuya station|Shibuya]], [[shinjuku station|Shinjuku]], and Ikebukuro. It is one of two limited express trains between [[Tokyo (city)|]] and [[Narita Airport]], the other being the Skyliner, operated by Keisei Electric Railway.

title: class_ef63
body:
A class of [[electric locomotive|Electric]] [[locomotive|locomotives]] formerly operating in Japan. 

[[Japan Railways|JNR]] [[Class EF63]] [[locomotive|locomotives]] were built between 1962 and 1976 exclusively for use as bankers (U.S. "helpers" or "pushers") on the steeply-graded Usui Pass section of the Shinetsu Main Line between Yokokawa and Karuizawa. They replaced the Class ED42 electric locomotives previously used on the rack-and-pinion line between these two stations.

body:
The 201 series (201系, 201-kei) is a DC electric [[multiple unit train]] (EMU) commuter train type introduced in 1979 by Japanese National Railways (JNR). It has been operated by [[West Japan Railway Company]] (JR-West) since 1987, and was formerly operated by [[East Japan Railway Company]] (JR East) from 1987 until 20 June 2011.

title: jr_east_209_series
body:
The 209 series (209系) is an  [[multiple unit train|electric multiple unit]] ([[multiple unit train|EMU]]) [[train|commuter train]] type operated by [[East Japan Railway Company]] (JR East) in the Tokyo area of Japan since 1993.

The 209 series was the first of the "New series trains" (新系列電車, Shin-keiretsu densha), and served as the basis for the E501, E217, 701, and E127 series rolling stock, as well as the succeeding [[JR East E231 Series|E231 series]] stock. which in turn became the blueprint for successive trains developed by JR East and other railway companies in Japan.

h4. Examples

The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of the [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Bao (vtuber)|]], referred to as her "winter" costume and was released on Valentines Day 2022.

It consists of a [[fur-trimmed capelet|fur-trimmed]] [[white capelet]] over a thick [[white dress]]. Underneath the winterwear is a lighter [[white dress]] with [[strap]]s, and further underneath that dress is a [[blue dress|blue]] [[strapless dress]]. In each variation she wears a [[blue bow]] on her neck, a single [[thigh strap]], and a pair of [[white footwear|white]] [[high heels]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this look, she has her [[very long hair|very ]] [[ponytail]], adorned with a [[white bow|hair bow]]. This outfit was the first to depict Bao with a [[cetacean tail|whale tail]], and was later updated to allow her to change colors, swapping her [[pink eyes]], [[pink hair|hair]], [[pink bow|bow]], light [[pink dress|dress]], and tail to pink.

title: rakan_dahkaran
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. He first appeared in the [[Gundam ZZ]] series from 1986.

[b]Rakan Dahkaran[/b] is a veteran [[Neo Zeon]] [[Mobile Suit]] officer. His mecha of choice are the [[Dreissen]], the [[Zaku III]] and the [[Doven Wolf]]. [spoilers]Dies during a pivotal [[space]] [[battle]] against [[Judau Ashta]] when his Doven is cut in half by Judau's [[Full Armor ZZ Gundam]]'s [[energy sword]].[/spoilers]

title: gundam_epyon
body:
[b]OZ-13MS Gundam Epyon[/b]
A Gundam-type [[Mobile Suit]] developed by [[Treize Khushrenada]] based on the [[Tallgeese]] and 5 Operation Meteor Gundams. True to Treize's philosophy of combat, it was only armed with melee weapons: a heat rod and a very high-output, large [[energy sword]] that is capable of destroying space fortresses. It also possessed the ability to transform into a flight mode (with a twin-headed dragon design), and was equipped with the fearsome [I]Epyon System[/I], a modified version of the ZERO System that enabled its pilot to control the battlefield. 

While it was originally [[Heero Yuy]] that relieved Treize of the Epyon, he later exchanges the unit for the [[Wing Gundam Zero]] with [[Zechs Merquise]] after a brief scuffle.

title: 00_raiser
body:
Mecha from Mobile Suit [[Gundam 00]]. Combined form of the GN-0000 [[00 Gundam]] and the GNR-010 [[0 Raiser]]. 

In this form, the 00 Gundam's Twin Drive System is now stabilized. Its [[Trans-Am]] System is not only can be safely used now, but also grants it new abilities such as Quantization (which is often theorized as a form of short-range spatial teleportation), generating a Quantum Ethereal Plane (where those within the battlefield would have a vision of him/herself floating nude and hearing other voices), using the Raiser Sword (a massive [[energy sword]] that can extend at great distances to cut down large objects like battle cruisers and satellite weapons), and if piloted by a True Innovator, access to Trans-Am Burst System (which super accelerates high grade GN Particles, capable of encompassing an entire battlefield to influence minds, thoughts, and health of people throughout the particle field).

The 00 Raiser retains the weaponry of both 00 Gundam and 0 Raiser. 

Its pilots are [[Setsuna F. Seiei]] (piloting the 00 Gundam) and [[Saji Crossroad]] (piloting the 0 Raiser).

title: protagonist_(smtv)
body:
The player character from [[Shin Megami Tensei V]].

A male high school student who appears rather [[androgynous]]. He has an [[asymmetrical hair|asymmetrical]] [[bowl cut]] with icy [[blue eyes]] and sports a [[school uniform]] with [[floral print]]. Upon fusing with [[Aogami (megami tensei)|]], his appearance alters as he transforms into another being known as a [b]Nahobino[/b]. Here his hair becomes [[blue hair|dark blue]] and [[very long hair|very long]], while his eyes change to a [[yellow eyes|bright yellow color]]. Whether it is part of his body or an article of clothing isn't entirely clear, but it appears that the protagonist wears some sort of [[bodysuit]] in this form, and he can cause a [[energy sword]] to protrude from his fingertips at will.

title: holding_beam_saber
body: Someone is [[holding]] a [[energy sword]].

title: fx_burst
body:
A special combat mode of the [[Gundam AGE-FX]], installed after its first deployment. Upon activation of the FX Burst Mode, the AGE-FX's limiters are disabled, maximizing its mobility at the cost of having decreased accuracy. It can wipe out large groups of enemy forces if used to its full potential.

When the FX Burst Mode is turned on, the AGE-FX turns blue and blue-colored [[energy sword|beam blades]] are emitted from ports all around the suit, including the [[funnels (gundam)|C-Funnels]]' storage points.

title: gehaburn
body:
Sword that appears in the [[Conquest End]] of [[choujigen game neptune mk2|Hyperdimension Neptunia mk2]] and its remake, Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;birth 2 Sisters Generation.

[spoiler]An evil sword that grows in power when used to slay CPUs.[/spoiler]

Takes the form of a [[energy sword]] with a light purple triangular blade and a dark purple hilt with two orange gems, one on the crossguard and one on the pommel.

Has a [[palette swap]] counterpart called the Share Blade, which has a light blue blade and gems and a light grey handle. The Share Blade appears in the Holy Sword Route of Re;birth 2 and as the "Beam Buster" weapon for Nepgear in [[choujigen action neptune u|Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed]].

title: tricorder
body: A tricorder is a fictional handheld sensor that exists in the [[Star Trek]] universe. The tricorder is a multifunctional hand-held device that can perform environmental scans, data recording, and data analysis; hence the word "tricorder" to refer to the three functions of sensing, recording, and computing. In Star Trek stories the devices are issued by the fictional Starfleet organization.

title: star_trek:_generations
body: Star Trek Generations is a 1994 American science fiction film and the seventh film in the [[Star Trek]] film series. Malcolm McDowell joins cast members from the 1960s television show Star Trek and the 1987 sequel series The Next Generation, including [[William Shatner]] and [[Patrick Stewart]]. In the film, Captain [[Jean-Luc Picard]] of the [[USS Enterprise NCC-1701-D|USS Enterprise-D]] joins forces with Captain [[james tiberius kirk|James T. Kirk]] to stop the villain Tolian Soran from destroying a planetary system in his attempt to return to an extra-dimensional realm known as the Nexus.

title: uss_enterprise_ncc-1701-a
body:
A fictional spacecraft from the [[Star Trek]] universe, and the primary setting for the fifth and sixth Star Trek films (it was seen briefly at the end of the fourth film).  Succeeded the [i]USS Enterprise[/i] NCC-1701 after that ship's destruction in Star Trek III: the Search For Spock, and was eventually replaced in-universe (after only 7 apparent years of service) by the [i]Enterprise[/i]-B.

No canon origin exists for the 1701-A.  A popular theory is that the ship was originally in service under another name (possibly [i]Yorktown[/i], per a comment supposedly made in passing by Gene Roddenberry himself after Star Trek IV had premiered) and was hurriedly renamed in the aftermath of the main events of Star Trek IV.  Some non-canon reference materials published in the 1980s speculated that the ship was a new build and was constructed for use as a testbed for the Transwarp drive project; Scotty's comments in Star Trek V about how the ship had numerous problems (and essentially broke down) on it's shakedown cruise would seem to support part of this theory.  Similarly, beyond being decommissioned after the events of Star Trek VI, the ship does not have a canon fate.  The non-canon novel The Ashes of Eden shows the ship being sold for use by the defense force of the planet Chal before being destroyed defending that world.

title: yaeno_muteki's_trainer
body:
Unnamed supporting character from [[Umamusume]] Cinderella Gray.  [[Yaeno Muteki (umamusume)|]]'s [[trainer (umamusume)|]] from the Cinderella Gray manga continuity.

Appears as a tall, [[long hair|long-haired]], imposing [[old man]] with [[mustache]] and [[beard]]. His overall appearance resembles an aged martial arts master, with some similarities to fan portrayals of [[Konpaku Youki]].

Long-time acquaintance of [[Musaka Ginjirou]] and [[Komiyama Masami]]. Also drinking buddies with Musaka.

h5. Associated characters

* [[Yaeno Muteki (umamusume)|]]

title: cranky_kong
body:
The elder of the Kong Family, introduced in [i][[Donkey Kong Country]][/i]. A grouchy, bitter old ape who constantly breaks the [[fourth wall]] to chastise [[Donkey Kong]] and reminisce about the good old days before the "newfangled graphics". 

While usually officially affirmed to being Donkey Kong's grandfather, some official sources claim he is the father instead. He is also the husband of Wrinkly Kong.

He has a [[very long beard|very long]] [[white beard]] and [[wrinkled_skin|wrinkled]] lips. He usually wears a [[brown sweater vest]], [[black-framed_eyewear|black]] [[glasses]] and typically holds a wooden walking [[cane]].

The Donkey Kong Country manual states that he was the ape that fought [[Mario]] and kidnapped [[Pauline (mario)|Pauline]] in the original [i][[Donkey Kong (1981 game)|Donkey Kong]][/i].

It is speculated among some fans that her design is a reference specifically to [[Metroid (Classic)]]'s [[Samus Aran]], but this has never been officially confirmed.

title: ryoshu_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus Company]] character.

Sinner No.04 of [[Limbus Company]]. Named and based on the main character Yoshihide of the 20th century short story "Hell Screen":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hell_Screen written by Japanese writer "Ryūnosuke Akutagawa":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ryūnosuke_Akutagawa.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] kept in a [[bob cut]], [[red eyes]], constantly [[smoking|smokes]] [[cigarette|cigarettes]], and always carries a [[sheathed]] [[ootachi]] across all of her identities. She wears the uniform of all [[Limbus Company]] Sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[black pants]], [[black coat]] she wears on her [[coat on shoulders|shoulders]], but excludes both the [[black vest]] and [[red necktie]] and wears an [[single glove|single]] [[black gloves|black glove]] on her left hand. 

She wields a sheathed [[ootachi]] wrapped in red ribbons in her base identity with the Japanese words ‘無我夢中 阿鼻叫喚 支離滅裂’ ('Delirious, screaming, incoherent' in English) written on the sheath.

title: d'vana_tendi
body: D'Vana Tendi is a fictional character from the American science fiction television series [[Star Trek: Lower Decks]]. She is the first Orion main character in a [[Star Trek]] show. Among Orions, she is known as the Mistress of the Winter Constellations.

title: beverly_crusher
body: Beverly Crusher is a fictional character in the [[Star Trek]] franchise, played by Gates McFadden. Debuting in the television series [[Star Trek: The Next Generation]], McFadden appeared in every season except for the second as well as its spin-off feature films: Star Trek Generations, Star Trek: First Contact, Star Trek: Insurrection, and Star Trek: Nemesis. McFadden returned to the role in the third season of [[Star Trek: Picard]]. She also had cameo appearances in Star Trek: Prodigy, both as a holographic recreation and the real Crusher.

[spoiler]As of Janury 8th 2019 (Patch 4.5 Part 1) she is also an NPC in [i][[Final Fantasy XIV]][/i], though her introduction was teased in the patch trailer on 21st December 2018.[/spoiler]

title: la_la_land
body: La La Land is a 2016 American musical romantic comedy-drama film written and directed by Damien Chazelle. It stars [[Ryan Gosling]] and [[Emma Stone]] as a struggling jazz pianist and an aspiring actress who meet and fall in love while pursuing their dreams in Los Angeles. The supporting cast includes John Legend, Rosemarie DeWitt, Finn Wittrock, and J. K. Simmons.

title: emma_stone
body: Emily Jean "Emma" Stone (born November 6, 1988) is an American actress and producer. Her accolades include two Academy Awards, two British Academy Film Awards, and two Golden Globe Awards. In 2017, she was the world's highest-paid actress and named by Time magazine as one of the 100 most influential people in the world.Stone began acting as a child in a theater production of The Wind in the Willows in 2000. As a teenager, she relocated to Los Angeles and made her television debut in In Search of the New Partridge Family (2004), a reality show that produced only an unsold pilot. After small television roles, she appeared in a series of well-received teen comedy films, such as [[Superbad (movie)|]] (2007), Zombieland (2009), and Easy A (2010), which was Stone's first leading role. Following this breakthrough, she starred in the romantic comedy Crazy, Stupid, Love (2011) and the period drama The Help (2011), and gained wider recognition as [[Gwen Stacy]] in the 2012 superhero film [[The Amazing Spider-Man]] and its [[the Amazing Spider-Man 2|2014 sequel]].  Stone received nominations for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress for playing a recovering drug addict in Birdman (2014) and Abigail Masham in The Favourite (2018). The latter marked her first of many collaborations with director Yorgos Lanthimos. She won two Academy Awards for Best Actress for her roles as an aspiring actress in the romantic musical [[La La Land]] (2016) and a resurrected suicide victim in Lanthimos' comic fantasy [[Poor Things (film)|]] (2023). She also portrayed tennis player Billie Jean King in Battle of the Sexes (2017) and the title role in Cruella (2021). On television, she starred in the dark comedy miniseries Maniac (2018) and The Curse (2023).

title: nambu_type_14
body:
The Nambu [b]Type 14[/b] is the finished product that came from Kijirou Nambu's experimental pistol prototype, the [b] Nambu 1902[/b]. It is the semi-automatic pistol that was adopted as the standard sidearm for officers of the Imperial Japanese Army in 1927. It would see service in this role during the [[second Sino-Japanese war]] in the 1930s, and and through to the end of [[World War II]]. the gun bears superficial resemblance to the [[germany|German]] [[luger_p08|Luger]], but the designs are not related.
h4. Related tags:

* [[handgun]]
* [[list of weapons]]

* [[Cosmo Nambu]]

h4. External links

* "A Wikipedia page for the pistol":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/nambu_pistol

title: michael_cera
body:
Michael Austin Cera is a Canadian actor. Cera became known for portraying leading roles in a string of comedic films such as [[Superbad (movie)|]] (2007), Juno (2007), and [[scott pilgrim vs the world (movie)|Scott Pilgrim vs the World]] (2010), Nick & Norah's Infinite Playlist (2008), and Youth in Revolt (2009). He took supporting roles in both comedies and dramas including Confessions of a Dangerous Mind (2002), This Is the End (2013), Molly's Game (2017), Person to Person (2017), Gloria Bell (2019), [[barbie (live action)|Barbie]] (2023), and Dream Scenario (2023). He voiced [[Dick Grayson]]/ [[robin (dc)|Robin]] in [[The Lego Batman Movie]] (2017), Barry in [[Sausage Party]] (2016) and Hank in Paws of Fury: The Legend of Hank (2022).

Cera gained prominence portraying George Michael Bluth in the Fox sitcom Arrested Development from 2003 to 2006 and then again from 2013 to 2019. He took a leading role in the Hulu comedy series Life & Beth (2022–2024), and also voiced roles including reprising his roles as Scott Pilgrim in the Netflix series Scott Pilgrim Takes Off (2023), and Barry in the Amazon Prime Video series Sausage Party: Foodtopia (2024).

title: superbad_(movie)
body: Superbad is a 2007 American coming-of-age teen buddy comedy film directed by Greg Mottola, written by [[Seth Rogen]] and Evan Goldberg, and produced by Judd Apatow. It stars [[Jonah Hill]] and [[Michael Cera]] as Seth and Evan, two teenagers about to graduate from high school. Before graduating, the boys want to party and lose their virginity, but their plan proves harder than expected. [[Christopher Mintz-Plasse]] (in his film debut), Rogen, Bill Hader, Martha MacIsaac, and [[Emma Stone]] (in her film debut) provide supporting roles.

title: christopher_mintz-plasse
body: Christopher Charles Mintz-Plasse (/mɪnts ˈplɔːs/; born June 20, 1989) is an American actor. Primarily known for his work in comedy films, he has performed roles such as Fogell / McLovin in [[Superbad (movie)|]] (2007), Augie Farcques in Role Models (2008), and Chris D'Amico in [[Kick-Ass]] (2010) and its sequel Kick-Ass 2 (2013). He also played the role of "Evil" Ed Lee in the 2011 remake of Fright Night.

title: khan_noonien_singh
body: Khan Noonien Singh is a fictional character in the [[Star Trek]] science fiction franchise who first appeared as the main antagonist in the [[Star Trek: The Original Series]] episode "Space Seed" (1967), and was portrayed by Ricardo Montalbán, who reprised his role in the 1982 film Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan. In the 2013 film [[Star Trek: Into Darkness]], he is portrayed by Benedict Cumberbatch.

title: shiranui_flare_(old_design)
body:
The original default design of [[hololive]]'s [[Shiranui Flare]], consisting of two versions.

The first version consists of several pieces linked together including an inner top layer with cleavage and back cutouts, an outer corset, collar and capelet layer with shoulder and upper back cutouts, [[detached sleeves]] with elbow pit cutouts as well as a [[single thighhigh]] and pumps of contrasting colors.

The second version is basically the same, but with some of the fanservice aspects toned down. The inner top layer no longer has a cleavage cutout and is is strapless instead, and she now wears side-tie shorts instead of what is assumed to be side-tie panties. To accommodate the shorts, her single thighhigh is shorter. This version of the design was used for her original 3D model.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3590234: Profile (original version)
* !post #3935402: Profile (second version)

title: k1-b0
body:
[i][[Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony]][/i] character.

The Ultimate Robot invented by [[Professor Iidabashi]]. He is a studious [[android]] learning what he can from the human students, but often feels prejudiced. While he was initially presented as a focal character in earlier promotional materials with [[Harukawa Maki]] and [[Momota Kaito]], the true protagonist was revealed later. Often seen with [[Oma Kokichi]] and [[Iruma Miu]].

He has [[short hair|short]] [[silver hair]] with  an [[ahoge]], and has [[blue eyes]]. As he is an android, his only clothes consist of [[power armor]]. His name is spelled as K1-B0 in the English localisation.

title: halftone
body:
A technique in which different tones of color [b]or[/b] shades of grey are simulated using a pattern of dots that vary in size, shape or spacing. These can appear either by artistic choice, or as a consequence of reproduction.

If the dots are all equal in size, use [[Ben-Day dots]] instead.

title: pickelhaube
body:
A spiked [[helmet]] of Prussian origin. It is typically associated with the Prussian and Imperial German army.

It is still worn currently in Portugal, Sweden, and many South American countries. 

Designed initially as a cavalry combat helmet, the spike at its top serves to deflect sword and saber strikes from an opponent cavalry man.

body:
[[Fate (series)|Fate series]] character. The mystic code of [[Gray (fate)|]] in [[Lord El-Melloi II Case Files]].

It has its own ego and is capable of speaking. Gray stores Add in a [[birdcage]] and usually keeps it hidden around the mantle inside the right sleeve. Its true function is to seal [[Rhongomyniad (fate)|]] from losing its mystery.

It can change form into a giant [[scythe]] called [[Grim Reaper (weapon) (fate)|Grim Reaper]], which Gray can use as a weapon. The scythe consumes Spiritual Body and Magical Energy and it has the ability to convert physical boost to the owner.

title: succulent_plant
body: [[plant|Plants]] whose parts are usually thickened, fleshy, and swollen to retain water in dry climates and soil conditions.

title: moss
body: A small flowerless green [[plant]] resembling carpet or short grass that can usually be seen growing on rocky terrain. Not to be confused with [[algae]] or [[mold]].

title: herb
body:
A catchall term for any [[plant]] with leaves, seeds, or flowers used for flavouring and/or garnishing [[food]], medicine, or perfume.

h4.Examples

* [[basil leaf]]
* [[mint]]
* [[parsley]]
* [[rosemary (herb)]]
* [[coriander]]

title: bamboo
body:
A tropical [[plant]] consisting of tall, green, tubular stems. It is technically a type of grass, but its woody tissue is as strong as timber, and the tallest species can grow to a height of nearly 100 feet (30 meters). Most species are native to Southeast Asia (around 64%), but the plant is also common in Latin America (around 33%). The rest are native mostly to Africa and Oceania, but North America does have three native species. 

Bamboo is used for various purposes, including cooking, construction, textiles, paper, furniture, and traditional medicine.

It is a dietary staple of the giant [[panda]], with which it is frequently depicted.

h4. See also 

* [[bamboo forest]] 
* [[bamboo broom]]
* [[bamboo shoot]]
* [[fukiya]]
* [[kadomatsu]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Bamboo":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bamboo]

title: grass
body:
A common word used to describe monocotyledonous green [[plant|plants]].

Use when an abundance of grass is present in an image, such as when someone is "lying on their back in a field":[/posts?tags=on_back+grass].

h4. See also

* [[field]]

title: clover
body:
Any [[plant|plants]] in the genus [i]Trifolium[/i], usually with leaves of three leaflets and [[clover (flower)|flowers]] that have spiked petals.

A [[shamrock]] is a type of clover that is the national symbol of [[Ireland]].

h4.See also

* [[club (shape)]]
* [[four-leaf clover]]
* [[clover hair ornament]]
** [[four-leaf clover hair ornament]]

title: willow
body:
A [[tree]] or shrub of temperate climates that grows near water and has long, thin branches that hang down - which yield osiers for basketry. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped. 

h4. See also
* "Wikipedia: Willow":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Willow]

title: pine_tree
body: [[tree|Trees]] in the genus Pinus in the family Pinaceae, they are evergreen trees meaning that their shrubs stay green even in winter.

title: baobab
body:
The common name for the nine species of [[tree]] in the genus Adansonia.

For tagging purposes the notable feature is the thick trunk and usually short limbs.

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia - Adansonia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adansonia]

body:

title: millenniumon
body:
A Composition Digimon. Millenniumon resembles a large feral beast, with four long, thin arms and large claws, and two large cannons on its back. It is said to be the fusion of a [[mugendramon|mechanical amalgam]] and an [[chimairamon|organic aberration]], and exudes immense power that transcends the limits of time and space.

In addition, it has two other forms: [[MoonMillenniumon]] and [[ZeedMillenniumon]].

title: mugendramon
body:
Type: Machine
Level: Ultimate
Attribute: Virus

A Machine [[Digimon]]. Mugendramon is a dinosaur-like amalgamation of parts from other Cyborg Digimon — [[Megadramon]]'s helmet and right claw, [[MetalTyranomon]]'s jaw and chest circuits, two of [[MetalMamemon]]'s Psycho Blasters, [[MetalGreymon]]'s left claw and chest plates, and [[Andromon]]'s shoulder pads. Its strongest Special Move is ∞ Cannon, for which it fires immensely strong energy waves from its twin cannons.

Mugendramon can be considered a mechanical counterpart to [[Chimairamon]], an organic Composite Digimon. Together, they can Jogress Evolve to become [[Millenniumon]].

Mugendramon is referred to as [b]Machinedramon[/b] in English material.

title: touhou_hisoutensoku
body:
東方非想天則 ~ 超弩級ギニョルの謎を追え
("Touhou Hisoutensoku ~ Choudokyuu Ginyoru no Nazo wo Oe")
("Unperceptive of Natural Laws of the East ~ Chase the Enigma of the Super Dreadnought Guignol")

Sixteenth game of the [[Touhou]] series, eleventh in the Windows generation, and fourth spinoff, as well as the third fighting spinoff made in collaboration with Tasogare Frontier. Also known as  "Touhou 12.3".

A [[hisou_tensoku|mysterious giant]] was found roaming in [[Gensokyo]]. In their formal debut to the fighting spinoffs, [[Kochiya Sanae]], [[Cirno]] and [[Hong Meiling]] seek this giant out to answer questions raised upon them by this entity.

Hisoutensoku also serves as an expansion pack for [i][[Scarlet Weather Rhapsody]][/i], expanding the roster to 20 playable characters - the most in a Touhou game.

body:
Holy stones which can calm [[earthquake]]s. The word 'Kaname-ishi' is often translated as 'keystone.'

In [[Touhou]], [[Hinanawi Tenshi]] is associated with an atypically floating keystone which has [i][[shimenawa]][/i] (sacred ropes) tied around it.

For the similarly named [[Pokemon]] items, see [[Mega Stone]] or [[Odd keystone]].

title: hawkgirl
body: Hawkgirl is the name of several superheroines appearing in American comic books published by [[DC Comics]]. The original Hawkgirl, Shiera Sanders Hall, was created by writer Gardner Fox and artist Dennis Neville, and first appeared in Flash Comics #1 (January 1940). Shayera Hol was created by writer Gardner Fox and artist Joe Kubert, and first appeared in The Brave and the Bold #34 (March 1961). Kendra Saunders was created by writer David S. Goyer and artist Stephen Sadowski, and first appeared in JSA: Secret Files and Origins #1 (August 1999). One of DC's earliest super-heroines, Hawkgirl has appeared in many of the company's flagship team-up titles including Justice Society of America and [[Justice League|Justice League of America]].

title: kyle_rittenhouse
body:
Khyle Howard Rittenhouse (born on January 3, 2003) is an American man who became famous on August of 2020 after appearing at Kenosha, Wisconsin amidst a [[protest]] that broke out at the time and shooting three people with an [[AR-15]] rifle, fatally wounding two of them. 
A year later, his actions were ruled as self-defense in court and was acquitted.
H4. External links
* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyle_Rittenhouse

title: joe_rogan
body:
Joseph James Rogan (born on August 11th, 1967) is an American comedian, commentator and host of his own series of podcasts, [[The Joe Rogan Experience]].
He is actually a cousin of [[My Chemical Romance]] members Mikey and [[Gerard Way]].

title: galarian_slowbro
body:
The Galarian form of [[Slowbro]].

It can be told apart from its Kantonian form by the [[Shellder]] that has attached itself to Slowbro's hand instead of its tail (resembling an [[arm cannon]]), causing a chemical reaction that made it so Slowbro began emitting poison - turning its head and extremities purple and changing its typing from Water/Psychic to Poison/Psychic.

title: vox_akuma
body:
[b]Vox Akuma[/b] is a [[Nijisanji EN]] [[virtual YouTuber]], from the fourth wave [[Luxiem]] and drawn by [[Lam (Ramdayo)]]. 

His character is a demon feudal lord from the Sengoku era of Japan, reawakened in the modern day, having lost the ability to speak Japanese.

Vox reached 1 million subscribers on July 24th, 2022. He is the fourth member of Nijisanji and the first member of the EN branch to reach this milestone.

Vox has [[medium hair|medium]] [[black hair|black]] [[multicolored hair|and]] [[red hair]]. He has [[yellow eyes]] with [[red eyeliner|red]] [[makeup]], and he's [[flat ass|more than a bit lacking in the cake department]] (much to his immense dismay).

h4. Costumes

* !post #5433986: [[Vox Akuma (1st costume)|Default]]
* !post #6246618: [[Vox Akuma (2nd costume)|2nd costume]]: Kimono

h4. Personality

Vox has a distinctive husky voice, which he puts to good use for (usually unseiso) ASMR videos, and while he does give off a sinister and mature impression at first glance, he's no less eccentric and quirky than his peers. He has a major interest in [[Five Nights at Freddy's]] and could go on tangents about the franchise's lore for days on end, and he's very good at cooking, having done a few cooking streams and frequently posting pictures of his food on Twitter.

h4. See also

* [[Oni Giri (Vox Akuma)|]], Vox's mascot/chat moderator.
* [[Kindred (Vox Akuma)|]], Vox's fanbase.
* [[Box Tenshi]], Vox's opposite-world angel double.
* "Voxanne":[/posts?tags=vox_akuma+genderswap_%28mtf%29], ([[genderswap (mtf)|genderbent]] version)

h4. External links

* "YouTube channel":[https://www.youtube.com/@VoxAkuma]
* "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/Vox_Akuma]

title: luca_kaneshiro
body:
A [[Nijisanji EN]] [[virtual YouTuber]], from the fourth wave [[Luxiem]] and designed by [[Itefu]].

Luca is a tall man with [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] in a [[short sidetail]] and [[purple eyes]]. He has tattoos on his [[chest tattoo|chest]], [[arm tattoo|left arm]], [[back tattoo|back]], [[finger tattoo|fingers]] and [[stomach tattoo|abdomen]]. He also has [[large pectorals]], something he repeatedly tries to deny.

title: deirdre_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Deirdre[/b] (ディアドラ, known as [b]Diadora[/b] in the Japanese version) is a major character from [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War]]. She is the wife of [[Sigurd (Fire Emblem)|Sigurd]] and mother of [[Seliph (Fire Emblem)|Seliph]].

[spoiler]Deirdre serves as the cornerstone of the game's entire plot. Some time into the adventure, [[manfroy (fire emblem)|Manfroy]] abducts and brainwashes Deirdre, then presents her to [[Arvis (fire emblem)|Alvis]]; additionally, she is revealed to be King Azmur's long-lost granddaughter and Prince Kult's daughter with Cigyun. Deirdre and Alvis are later married, unaware of their relation as half-siblings, and have twins together: [[Julius (Fire Emblem)|Julius]], vessel of [[Loptous (Fire Emblem)|]], and [[Julia (Fire Emblem)|Julia]], vessel of [[Naga (Fire Emblem)|]]. Deirdre meets her end when Julius slays her with Loptous's power.[/spoiler]

Holy Blood: [b][[Naga (Fire Emblem)|]][/b] (major), [spoiler][[Loptous (Fire Emblem)|]] (minor)[/spoiler]

title: arvis_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Arvis[/b] is a character from [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War]]. He is the Duke of Velthomer, and a full-blooded descendant of Crusader [[Fjalar (Fire Emblem)|]], allowing him to use the sacred tome [[Valflame]].

Arvis serves as one of the main antagonists of the game. [spoiler]He is convinced to marry [[Deirdre (Fire Emblem)|]], both unaware that they share the same mother and are thus half-siblings. The result of their union are twin children, [[Julia (Fire Emblem)|]] and [[Julius (Fire Emblem)|]]. Arvis kills [[Sigurd (Fire Emblem)|]] and his companions in the Battle of Belhalla, slaughtering almost all of the first generation. Later, he ascends the throne as Emperor of Grannvale, although he effectively holds no power due to the Loptr Church controlling Grannvale behind his back. Arvis ultimately meets his end by the blade of Sigurd's son, [[Seliph (Fire Emblem)|]].[/spoiler]

title: apocaly_the_end
body: A [[Medarot]] based on [[Apocalymon]].

title: sigurd_(fire_emblem)
body:
Sigurd (romanized as [b]Siglud[/b] in the Japanese version) is the main Lord character of [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War]], the inheritor of the duchy of Chalphy and a full-blooded descendant of Crusader [[Baldr (Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War)|]]. [[Deirdre (Fire Emblem)|]] is his wife, and together, they have a son named [[Seliph (Fire Emblem)|]].

As a full-blooded descendant of Crusader Baldo, Sigurd wields the holy sword [[Tyrfing (Fire Emblem)|]], which is later passed down to his son Seliph.

[spoilers]Sigurd is ultimately killed by [[Arvis (Fire Emblem)|]] at the end of the First Generation, and his son Seliph succeeds him for the Second Generation.[/spoilers]

Holy Blood: [b][[Baldr (Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War)|]][/b] (major)

title: seliph_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Seliph Baldos Chalphy[/b] is the second main protagonist of [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War]]. As the son of [[sigurd_(fire_emblem)|Sigurd]] and his wife [[deirdre_(fire_emblem)|Deirdre]], Seliph is a full-blooded descendant of Crusader [[Baldr (Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War)|]] with partial [[Naga (Fire Emblem)|]] blood. He serves as the main Lord character of the second generation, succeeding his father Sigurd and finishing what he started.

Seliph inherits the legendary weapon [[Tyrfing (Fire Emblem)|Tyrfing]] from Sigurd in the final years of the war with the Granvalle Empire.

Holy Blood: [b][[Baldr (Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War)|]][/b] (major), [[Naga (Fire Emblem)|]] (minor)
other_names: セリス・バルドス・シアルフィ

title: fire_emblem:_genealogy_of_the_holy_war
body:
The fourth game in the [[Fire Emblem]] series, released in 1996 for the [[Super Famicom]].

The game is divided between two generations, with the First Generation featuring [[Sigurd (Fire Emblem)|]] and his exploits on the continent of Jugdral, as he unravels a conspiracy against the Kingdom of Grannvale. The Second Generation focuses on Sigurd's son, [[Seliph (Fire Emblem)|]], who leads a resistance against the now corrupt Grannvale Empire, orchestrated by the Cult of Loptous.

While obscure, it is generally considered one of the best Fire Emblem games ever made, due to its engaging story, interesting characters, and vast worldbuilding.

title: humvee
body:
The [b]High Mobility Multipurpose Wheeled Vehicle (HMMWV)[/b], commonly known as the [b]Humvee[/b], is a four-wheel-drive military automobile produced by the American company AM General since 1984.

It was the [[united states|U.S.]] armed forces replacement for the [[military jeep]], and is in turn being partly replaced by the Oshkosh L-ATV. 

Note that [[Hummer]] is the civilian version of the Humvee and has progressively become less and less similar to the military variant.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Humvee

title: hound_(transformers)
body:

[quote]Motto: [i]"Observe everything, remember even more...".[/i][/quote]

title: mk19_grenade_launcher
body:
The Mk 19 (pronounced Mark 19) is an American 40 mm [b]automatic [[grenade launcher]][/b] that was first developed during the [[Vietnam War]]. Entered [[military]] service since 1968. It replaced the earlier hand-cranked "Mk 18":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mk_18_Mod_0_grenade_launcher].

The Mk 19 is a belt-fed, blowback-operated, air-cooled, crew-served, fully-automatic [[weapon]] that is designed not to cook off. It fires 40 mm grenades at a cyclic rate of 325 to 375 rounds per minute, giving a practical rate of fire of 60 rounds per minute (rapid) and 40 rounds per minute (sustained). Though the Mk 19 has a flash suppressor, it serves only to save the eyesight of its operator, not concealing the weapon's position. For [[night]] operation, a picatinny rail quadrant sight can be added for [[thermal scope|thermal]] and [[night vision]] [[optical sight|optics]]. 

Due to its low recoil and comparatively light weight, the [[weapon]] has been adapted for use on many different platforms, including small attack [[boat]]s, [[aircraft]]s, fast attack vehicles such as the [[Humvee]], AAV and Stryker, [[military jeep]]s, and a large variety of naval mounts.

h4. See also
* [[AGS-30]] - The Russian "counterpart".
* [[List of weapons]]
* Wikipedia page: "Mk 19 grenade launcher":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mk_19_grenade_launcher]

title: m151_(truck)
body: [b]Truck, Utility, ¼-Ton, 4×4, M151[/b] was the last generation of the traditional "[[military jeep|jeep]]" light utility vehicles fielded by the United States armed forces. It was developed by the Ford Motor Company under a 1951 contract to replace the U.S. Army's fleet of Willys M38 jeeps, which in turn were the successors to the original Bantam-based Willys MB and Ford GP jeeps of World War II. The M151 strongly resembles its predecessors, but is larger and based on a completely new platform. Visually, it is easily distinguished by its horizontally slotted front grille (since the classic vertical grille of the earlier jeeps was, by 1951, a trademarked aspect of the civilian Jeeps being sold by Willys). The M151 was replaced starting in 1983 by the [[humvee|HMMWV]], but a few examples are allegedly still used by some Special Forces units today.

title: sports_utility_vehicle
body:
[B]Sport utility vehicle[/b] (SUV) is a [[car]] classification that has off-road features, such as four-wheel drive and higher ground clearance. SUVs are generally built on light truck chassis and have bulkier dimensions compared to regular cars.

As consumer tastes have evolved to prefer SUVs to standard cars, less rugged takes on the platform have emerged, including SUV-like vehicles based on car chassis, known as [b]CUV[/b]s or "Crossovers." For danbooru purposes, these types of vehicles are included under this tag.

h1. Examples
[b]Traditional rugged-style SUVs:[/b]
* !post #6145304: [[Jeep Wrangler]]
* !post #6297396: [[Hummer H2]]
* !post #6661558: [[Mercedes-Benz G-Class]]
* !post #6634602: [[Mitsubishi Pajero]]
* !post #6656344: [[Toyota Land Cruiser]]

[b]Modern "round" SUVs and CUVs:[/b]

This tag is specifically for vehicles produced by the Jeep brand. For the general style of vehicle based on the original military version, see [[Military jeep]].

title: mugen_masato
body:
A main character from the [[Tokusou Kihei Dorvack]] science fiction anime TV series from the 80s. 

[b]Mugen Masato[/b] is a human [[mecha]] pilot who fights to protect the Earth. Masato pilots the [i]VV-54 AR[/i] [[Mugen Calibur]], a type of transforming [[military jeep]] mecha.

He is of japanese ethnicity and is also a [[martial arts]] expert. Masato usually carries a pair of red [[glasses]] in his head.

title: tokusou_butai_jackkaru
body:
[b]Tokusou Butai Jackkaru[/b], also known in the west as [b]Jackal[/b] (and distributed under the title of [b]Top Gunner[/b]) is an overhead run-and-gun shooter [[video game]] by [[KONAMI]] released as an [[arcade]] in 1986. 

In the game the player must maneuver an armed [[military jeep]] in order to rescue prisoners of war (POWs) trapped in enemy territory.

Jackal was released for the [[Nintendo]] [[NES]] and [[Famicom]] [[game console]]s in 1988.

title: mugen_calibur
body:
A fictional transformable [[mecha]] from the [[Tokusou Kihei Dorvack]] science fiction anime TV series from the 80s. 

The [b]VV-54 AR Mugen Calibur[/b] is a variable heavy armored [[military jeep]] that can transform into a humanoid ground combat mecha. It is armed with energy weaponry and is piloted by [[Mugen Masato]].

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

title: military_jeep
body:
A type of light utility vehicle, primarily used for military purposes or civilian offroading. The most prominent Jeep model used by the [[military vehicle|military]] was the Willys MB, since the World War II. The design was licensed for production to many marques around the world (in addition to unlicensed copycats), making it a ubiquitous design with many variants.

Jeeps are visually distinguishable by their seven-slot vertical grille flanked with two circular headlights.

This is a generic tag for Jeep-like utility vehicles regardless of specific model, manufacturer, or country of origin. For the modern American manufacturer, see [[Jeep (Company)]].

h4. See also

* [[Jeepney]]
* [[Humvee]]
* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

Small mammals adapted to a subterranean lifestyle. They have cylindrical bodies, velvety fur, very small, inconspicuous ears and eyes, reduced hindlimbs, and short, powerful forelimbs with large paws adapted for [[digging]].

For the beauty mark, see [[mole]].

body: [b]PewDiePie[/b] (real name Felix Arvid Ulf Kjellberg) is a [[sweden|Swedish]] Youtuber and internet celebrity. At 109 million subscribers, his channel remains one of the most subscribed on the platform.

title: full_course_(armored_core_vi)
body: The AC piloted by [[cinder carla|"Cinder" Carla]], a heavy weight bipedal AC with exclusively RaD produced parts and weapons, interesting all the component names are related to food. Armaments consist entirely of [[missile pod]]s and [[rocket launcher|missile launchers]]. Painted in navy blue, pink and maroon red.

title: mind_gamma_(armored_core_vi)
body: An AC <spoilers>joint piloted by [[g5 Iguazu (armored core 6)|G5 Iguazu]] and [[allmind (armored core vi)|ALLMIND]], serves as the door boss for the final mission of the story route 'Alea Iacta Est',</spoilers> in the game [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. A [[reverse-jointed legs|reverse jointed]] AC made up advanced parts <spoilers>developed and produced by ALLMIND</spoilers>, armaments includes both energy and kinetic projectile guns, shoulder mounted shield projector and a [[shoulder cannon]]. Painted in silver and grey, with green glowing elements in various areas.

title: sea_spider_(armored_core_vi)
body: IA-13: SEA SPIDER A boss [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. A Coral-powered C-weapon developed by the Rubicon Research Institute. A hexapodal autonomous [[walker (robot)|walker]] capable of high speed terrastrial movement, leaping distances, and capable of hover flight. Outfitted with Coral-powered weapons in form beam and homing missiles, as well as having a Coral oscillator melee weapon on each of its six legs.

title: g5_iguazu_(armored_core_vi)
body:
A NPC acting as the player's rival <spoilers>and later on a recurring antagonist</spoilers> in the game [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. A 4th gen augmented human and AC pilot associated with the Balam corporation group, a member of their in-house AC mercenary group 'Redguns', assigned the title G5 (Pronounced 'Gun 5') Iguazu, referring to the Iguazu river/waterfall in Brazil and Argentina, South America. He pilots the AC '[[head bringer (armored core vi)|Head Bringer]]'<spoilers>, AC 'MIND Gamma' and a modified [[sol_644|SOL 644]] with ALLMIND markings</spoilers>.

There is no canon depiction of Iguazu in game save one line of text suggesting his face was [[scar on face|scarred]]/[[disfigured]] as a result of a fist-fight. Because of his callsign, he may be depicted with Latin-American ethnicity, or [[animalization|animalized]] as an [[iguana]].

Voiced by: Griffin Burns (EN), Tsuchida Hiroshi (JP)

title: head_bringer_(armored_core_vi)
body: The AC piloted by [[g5 Iguazu (armored core 6)|G5 Iguazu]] in  [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. A bipedal AC made up entirely of the Balam produced 'Melander C3' parts and Dafeng produced internal combustion generator. Armaments include a light MG 'Ludlow', linear rifle 'Curtis', a shoulder pulse shield, and a shoulder mounted [[missile pod]]. Painted in teal, grey and maroon red.

title: cataphract_(armored_core_vi)
body: AAS02: CATAPHRACT An enemy boss unit that appears in [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]], a heavy mobile craft used by the Planetary Closure Administration's forces. Has four [[caterpillar tracks|caterpillar track treads]] to provide mobility, while the heavy turret up top plays host to a 32-cell [[missile_pod|missile launcher]], a spread laser cannon, and two six-barrel [[gatling gun|gatling cannons]], two larger calibre four-barrel gatling cannons is fitted on each of the two front treads as hull-mounted armaments. Cataphract is piloted by a smaller MT chassis attached to the front, coincidentally being the Cataphract's only weak point.

title: echo_(armored_core_vi)
body:
An unmanned bipedal AC reassembled using classified means <spoiler>by [[allmind (armored core vi)|ALLMIND]]</spoilers>, the new designation 'Echo' is without a serial code, though its made up parts produced by the Rubicon Research Institute under the serial code IA-C01X 'Ephemera'. Despite being developed half a century prior, like all Institute developed machines, it is able to keep up and exceed modern weapons in many aspects thanks to it's Coral-powered technology. The AC Echo has an alien but yet feminine appearance, it is painted entirely in black, silver and pink.

<spoilers>Echo is first encountered as an enemy unit around the mid chapters of the game simply under the designation 'Institute AC', painted entirely in silver with red arm units.</spoilers>

<spoilers>Though designed to be unmanned, when it's reassembled into the Echo, it was piloted by [[ayre (armored core vi)|Ayre]] in the story route 'Alea Iacta Est' to assist the player character in the final mission.</spoilers>

title: milk_tooth_(armored_core_vi)
body: The AC piloted by "Honest" Brute, a bipedal AC with exclusively RaD produced parts, weaponry includes [[flamethrower]], large [[chainsaw]], shoulder [[missile pod]] and [[shoulder cannon|shoulder bazooka]]. Painted in gold, beige and grey.

title: balteus_(armored_core_vi)
body: AAP07: Balteus An enemy boss unit that appears in [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]], an autonomous craft used by the Planetary Closure Administration's forces. Balteus is made up of a large mobile platform, a horizontal ring, and an MT attached to the middle serving as the control centre. The large platform provides high speed flight, hover, all-direction Pulse Armor projection, the horizontal ring serves as an attachment rail system for armaments such as missile launchers, flame throwers and flame swords, the MT chassis itself also carries a dual-[[gatling gun]] and a multi-barrelled scatter gun. Balteus is heavily armed, armoured and incredibly agile for its size, it is later on developed into the 'AAP07A: Arquebus Balteus'.

title: nightfall_(armored_core_vi)
body:
The poster AC of [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]], featured in various trailers of the game prior to launch and available as a scale figure in the game's Collector's Edition. Nightfall is a modified RaD scout AC, with its specifications being identical to the players' starting AC unit LOADER 4 except for the head unit being modified by an anonymous party. Armaments includes a shoulder mounted compact duo 3-cell [[missile pod]], [[shoulder cannon|shoulder grenade cannon]] 'Songbirds', assault rifle 'Scudder' and the devastating melee weapon 'Ashmead' [[pile bunker]].

Nightfall is piloted by the independent mercenary [[raven (armored core vi)|Raven]].

title: raven_(armored_core_vi)
body:
[[Armored Core Vi: Fires Of Rubicon]] character. For the player character, see [[621 (armored core vi)|C4 621]].

The true 'Raven' whom the player borrowed the callsign from after gaining illegal entry into the planet Rubicon III, pilots the AC [[nightfall (armored core vi)|Nightfall]]. Official gender is unknown, as only the operator speaks on behalf,  but the Karl Urban-played character standing in front of Nightfall in the live action trailer seems to suggest a man.

<spoilers>Around the mid chapters of the game, Raven appears before the player and challenges them to a duel, not as reprimand for the act of identity theft, but to examine their ability to "live up to the Raven's name". Upon defeating Nightfall, the title of Raven is inherited by the player character [[621 (armored core vi)|C4 621]].</spoilers>

title: sol_644
body: IB-07: SOL 644 An end boss of [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. An unmanned bipedal mech developed by the Rubicon Research Institute as part of their Ibis series of C-weapons, making full use of Coral-powered system for offense, defense and utility. Outfitted with four pairs of double barrelled Coral homing launchers (2x [[shoulder cannon|shoulder mount]] and 2x wrist mount), Coral [[energy sword]] and a Coral rifle. Its manoeuvrability rivals that of [[ibis-series_cel-240|CEL 240]], its offensive capability rivals and possibly exceeding that of [[HAL 826]]. Though it is developed as an unmanned C-weapon, it was piloted by [[ayre (armored core vi)|Ayre]] in the route 'Fires of Raven', serving as her mean to fight the player character [[621 (armored core vi)|C4 621]] and stop the colony ship Xylem, in the bid to save both her kins and the planet Rubicon III. In the 'Alea Iacta Est' route, the SOL 644 is modified for joint operation by [[allmind (armored core vi)|ALLMIND]] and [[g5 iguazu (armored core vi)|G5 Iguazu.]] This modified SOL 644 is black in appearance, and uses green pulse energy instead of Coral. It is armed with green energy swords that can transform into [[energy_claws]].

title: kate_markson
body: A side character in Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon, an independent mercenary, pilots the AC 'Transcriber'. [spoiler]Heavily implied to be a fake persona created and controlled by the [[allmind (armored core vi)|Allmind]] AI system.[/spoiler]

title: allmind_(armored_core_vi)
body:
An artificial intelligence in [[Armored Core Vi: Fires Of Rubicon]]. She exists as a support network for mercenaries, handling contract offers, training, logistics, and more. She is often [[personification|personified]] in fanart as a domineering [[office lady]] with [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] and [[green eyes]].

h4. References
* !asset #22533734: ALLMIND's in-game icon
* !post #6644386: The earliest personification of ALLMIND by [[las91214]], largely used as the basis for other fanart and personifications.

title: handler_walter
body: The player's typical mission control in [[Armored Core Vi: Fires Of Rubicon]], Handler Walter has earned notoriety for using and disposing of augmented humans in high-risk missions throughout settled space. His latest subject, [[621 (armored core vi)|C4-621]], proved to be far harder to kill.
other_names: ハンドラー・ウォルター

title: loader_4
body: The players' default AC from the game [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]], piloted by the player character [[621 (armored core vi)|C4-621]]. LOADER 4 is a RaD scout AC using all XC-2000 series RaD produced parts and BAWS produced internal combustion generator. Default armaments include [[energy blade]], assault rifle and right side shoulder mounted [[missile pod]]. LOADER 4 is easily distinguished by its elongated head unit, the orange glow on its head unit also giving it an [[one-eyed]] appearance. LOADER 4 is painted primarily in gunmetal grey and black, with various glowing orange parts around the body.

title: 621_(armored_core_vi)
body: The protagonist of [[Armored Core Vi: Fires Of Rubicon]]. They are someone who was left "brain-fried" under mysterious circumstances before being sent to Rubicon III, ostensibly to secure the planet's valuable Coral and earn the pay necessary for restorative surgery. They are depicted either in their Armored Core, or as a completely-bandaged figure.

title: ayre_(armored_core_vi)
body:
A supporting character who appears midway through [[Armored Core Vi: Fires Of Rubicon]].

The player character first encounters her as a disembodied voice in his head, along with a red cast over his vision. She is [spoiler]a persona created by the Coral, who seeks to unify it and humanity. Though suspected by Walter to be the harbinger of a horrific assimilation plot, she is in fact quite hopeful that humanity and Coral can forge a strong and genuine bond.[/spoiler] 

Though she has no canon appearance, most fanart portrays her as having red-tinted [[pale skin]], [[red eyes]], and [[white hair]].

Voiced By: Erin Yvette (EN), [[Fairouz Ai]] (JP)

title: scythe
body:
A traditional long handled agricultural tool used to harvest whole plants, such as hemp or wheat. Commonly depicted as a weapon of choice used by the [[grim reaper]] as a tool to reap souls, or by other mythological beings. 

Although often seen in fantasy and anime as a [[weapon]], it is only tangentially connected to the "war scythe", which is a [[polearm]] having more in common with a [[glaive (polearm)|]], fauchard or [[naginata]] than with the original tool.

h4. See also

* [[sickle]]
* [[kama (weapon)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Scythe":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scythe]

title: baby_yoshi
body:
The newly-hatched infant forms of the [[Yoshi]]s, introduced in [i][[Super Mario World]][/i]. They are unable to move on their own and need to be carried around. They can eat anything, and after eating a certain threshold of fruits, items or enemies they usually grow into normal Yoshis.

h6. Baby Yoshi Exclusive Abilities

* [[Balloon Baby Yoshi]]
* [[Bubble Baby Yoshi]]
* [[Glowing Baby Yoshi]]

The design of the Yoshis in [i][[Yoshi's Story]][/i], despite being more representative of the current modern design, were said to be Baby Yoshis within the game's setting. Despite this, do not tag the Yoshi's Story Yoshis as Baby Yoshis. 

h4. See Also
* [[baby_fat_(super_mario_rpg)|Baby Fat]]
* [[Mini-Yoshi]]

title: getian_(reverse:1999)
body:
[b]Getian[/b] is a playable character from [[Reverse:1999]]. He is one of the protagonist of the "Notes on Shuori" sidestory. He is a Miemeng, mythical beast with green wings and red tails. He often secluded himself in the mountains, only recently going down to help lost "horses" to be put in one of the tavern in Pei City, before she mysteriously missing. He have arcane skill to read someone's bones and see their past and personality, and also an arcane skill to automatically translate speeches, as shown to be used to [[Yenisei (Reverse:1999)|Yenisei]] because she can't understand his language.

He is voiced by [[Eguchi Takuya]] in Japanese, and his English voice actor has yet to be revealed...

h4. Appearance

* !post #7149118: Insight II: The Breeze of Ease

title: ex-rumia
body:
A fanmade character based off of [[Rumia]] from [[Touhou]].

It has been speculated that the ribbon on Rumia's head acts as a seal on her true powers.

In EX form, her ribbon usually becomes a [[halo]], and she commonly wields a large sword (most likely "Stormbringer":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stormbringer]) and freely manipulates darkness. She is also sometimes depicted as an adult and/or with wings in this form. It is also not uncommon to see her ribbon floating above her head in a similar fashion to a halo. She becomes more mature and more serious in this form.

EX-Rumia prominently featured as the main character of the fanwork [[Osana Reimu]], and the antagonist of its sequel [[Reireimu]].

title: candy_kong
body:
A Kong introduced in [i][[Donkey Kong Country]][/i]. 

[[Donkey Kong]]'s rumored love interest and a good friend who always helps him out along with the other Kongs. She is sultry and alluring, always affectionate in manner and speech. 

In Donkey Kong Country she has a [[pink leotard]] and wears a [[large_bow|large]] [[pink bow]] on top of her head. In [[Donkey Kong 64]] she wears a [[pink shirt]] [[crop top]] with her name "Candy" [[clothes writing|written]] on it, [[pink shorts]] and is the only iteration to wear [[pink footwear|pink shoes]]. She also has [[purple eyeshadow]], [[pink nails|pink]] [[nail polish]], a [[necklace]] and carries a blue [[walkman]]. Her current standard look was introduced starting from [[DK: King of Swing]], having her retain much of the design introduced in Dk64, but now wears a [[pink camisole]] that retains her name written on it. Her eyeshadow is now more [[blue eyeshadow|blue]], she is [[barefoot]] again and loses her necklace and walkman. All iterations have [[medium hair|medium]] [[blonde hair]], [[large breasts]], pronounced [[pink lips|pink]] [[thick lips]] and most give her [[blue eyes]], though she had [[green eyes]] in the original DKC.

She is the tallest and most humanoid of the Kongs, standing completely upright and being the most proportioned like a human.

title: tiny_kong
body:
A member of the Kong Family introduced in [i][[Donkey Kong 64]][/i], and has participated in one [[Mario (series)|Mario]] spinoff game, [i][[Mario Super Sluggers]][/i].

Her most significant traits is her [[blonde_hair|blonde]] [[twintails]], as similar to [[Dixie Kong]] they are used to attack enemies and allow her to descend slowly to the ground like a helicopter. As her name "Tiny" suggests, she also has the ability to shrink in size when entering a Tiny Barrel.

Originally she was depicted with [[blue overalls]] that were [[print_overalls|printed]] with a [[floral_print|flower]] [[smiley face]] on them. Under the overalls were a [[white shirt]] and she wore [[white footwear|white shoes]]. After the drastic redesign she received in [i]Diddy Kong Racing DS[/i] onward however her current depiction is vastly different. She is now much more humanoid in figure like [[Candy Kong]], given noticeable [[eyelashes]], and applies [[red eyeshadow]] and [[pink_nails|pink]] [[nail polish]]. She now wears [[blue pants|blue]] [[sweatpants]], a [[blue camisole]] [[crop top]] with a similar flower smiley face and [[pink_footwear|pink]] [[sandals]] along with [[hoop earrings]] and white [[fur wrist cuffs]]. Aside from the aforementioned blonde twintails, both iterations have [[blue eyes]] and a similar [[multicolored headwear|multicolored]] [[beanie]].

She was initially Dixie Kong's younger sister but after the redesign it is unsure if this setting is still in consideration.

title: matsunaga_ryo
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. Ryo is a horror movie and death metal fanatic, though she appreciates music genres like jazz and classical. She is a good friend of [[Shirasaka Koume]], as the two share many interests. While she enjoys horror, she tends to be bored by most horror films. That said, she isn't immune to fear like Koume and can be scared by ghosts.
She was a vocalist in a band, and in the anime, she was introduced as a member of [[Kimura Natsuki]] prospective band. However, she is a kind girl who cares about the other younger girls, like [[Sasaki Chie]] and [[Shirasaka Koume]], and how they feel. Her company often gets her into trouble, but she admits that she enjoys their antics as long as they end peacefully. 

Voiced by [[Chisuga Haruka]] [千菅 春香].
