title: range_finder
body:
A device used to determine the distance between a 'target' and the observer. Range finders are usually seen in military applications, though they are also utilized in civilian use cases such as [[Golf]], [[Taking Picture|Photography]]. or forestry.

there are three predominant categories of range finder:
- [[Laser]]
     Usually the most compact, Laser Range Finders are often seen next to [[Sniper Rifle|snipers]], used to adjust lead for a shot.
- Stereoscopic
     A horizontal tube with apertures at either end and a pair of eye pieces near the center. Stereoscopic Range Finders make use of human stereoscopic vision to line up the images coming from either end to find an accurate distance to target.
- Coincidence
     Similar to the Stereoscopic Range Finder, albeit with only one eye piece, Coincidence Range Finders split the incoming images and overlay one top above the other's bottom. when the two images are adjusted to line up, an accurate range will be found.

In general, Stereoscopic and Coincidence Range Finders benefit from being wider and higher up, leading to them predominantly being seen high in the superstructure of warships up through [[World War II|WWII]] before being phased out in favor of [[radar]] range finders. Medium-to-large naval [[turret|turrets]] often featured one or more integrated range finders, such as are seen protruding from the sides of the 16-inch/50-caliber mark 7 gun turrets of the [[uss_iowa_(bb-61)|Iowa-class]].

title: feminization
body:
Also called "sissification", feminization is a type of fetish where the focus is on a man (particularly [[androgynous]] men) [[crossdressing]] and being groomed into behaving more feminine. Is often done as either an act of humiliation, as the result of hypnosis, or to establish dominance (especially in [[femdom]] relationships). Some examples may even include medical alterations, like those caused by hormone therapy or more supernatural means, though it needs to be clear the character was originally male.

This term also applies to [[tomboy|tomboyish]] girls being forced to act more conventionally feminine.

[b]Note:[/b] do not tag all content specifically focusing on a male at birth character [[crossdressing]] or with gender-questioning themes as feminization.

h4. See also
* [[Bimbofication]] - A similar concept of turning a character into a hyperfeminine version of themselves, but specifically made to be overly sexual and airheaded
* [[Genderswap (mtf)]] - Fiction often depicts sex changes far more complete than current medical science can produce. Both tags can overlap if it's clear without outside knowledge the character was previously male and an outside force caused them to become completely female.

title: dryad_(terraria)
body:
An NPC in [[Terraria]], first debuting at the game's launch in 2011 (1.0.0). The last remaining member of a mythical line of nature spirits that first felled [[Cthulhu]]. She is popular because as a [[dryad]], she only wears a [[leaf bikini]] and [[vines]].

She joins the player's world if one of these following bosses are defeated: [[Eye of Cthulhu]], Eater of Worlds, Brain of Cthulhu, or Skeletron.

title: theet_(peach)
body:
A race of small, round humanoids introduced in [i][[Princess Peach: Showtime!]][/i] They appear at the Sparkle Theater. 

They all have [[blue eyes]], [[yellow skin]], [[white gloves]] and [[big nose|big]] [[round nose]] that can [[glowing|light up]] in a variety of colors. They take on a multitude of roles and outfits throughout the game.

In her human form, she has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[glasses]], a [[blue shirt]], and an [[id card]] on a [[lanyard]].

In her yuki onna form, she has [[white hair]], piercing [[blue eyes]], and [[pointy ears]].

title: fabius_bile
body:
Fabius Bile, also called the "Clone Lord," the "Primogenitor," the "Manflayer" and "the Spider," is a [[Chaos Space Marine]] [[apothecary_(warhammer 40k)|Apothecary]] and Chaos Lord, originally the Chief Apothecary of the [[Emperor's Children]] Legion, who has repeatedly attempted to use his extensive knowledge of cloning and genetic engineering to create superhuman beings under his control.

The goal of his quest for knowledge is to match and then exceed the [[Emperor of Mankind]]'s original scientific achievement in creating the [[primarch]]s and the transhuman [[Adeptus Astartes]], in the hope of creating a truly perfect human form.

title: american_mcgee's_alice
body:
American McGee's Alice is a third-person action PC video game which takes place in the Alice's Adventures in Wonderland universe. This Alice is designed by [[american_mcgee_(artist)|American Mcgee]].

Set years after [[Alice in Wonderland]] and [i]Through the Looking-Glass and What Alice Found There[/i], the game features a more mature, cynical and macabre incarnation of Alice.

She is now an older, dark-brown haired young woman with emerald green eyes. She wears a dark navy dress and a white apron with alchemical symbols, and is often drawn with a long butcher [[knife]].

In Japanese the game is titled "Alice in Nightmare" (アリス イン ナイトメア).

The game also has a sequel titled [[Alice: Madness Returns]].

A prequel titled [i]Alice: Asylum[/i] was pitched, but failed to be greenlit. Following this, McGee chose to retire the series and step away from game development.

h4. External link

* "Wikipedia: American McGee's Alice":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_McGee's_Alice

title: century_egg_(food)
body:
Century eggs, also known as pidan, preserved eggs, hundred-year eggs, thousand-year eggs, thousand-year-old eggs, century-old eggs, millennium eggs, skin eggs, black eggs or old eggs are a traditional Asian dish featuring eggs that have been preserved in a curing mixture for several weeks to several months.

The outer egg white turns into a dark brown, translucent jelly, while the inner egg yolk becomes dark green and squishy.

title: amagi_(cv)_(azur_lane)
body:
The UR re-imagination of [[Azur Lane]]'s [[Amagi (azur lane)|]] under a planned, but never realized aircraft carrier conversion. She is voiced by [[Sawashiro Miyuki]]. 

She retains the same body and memories of the original Amagi but now pairs it with a new outfit and rigging. Her carrier-spec outfit consists of a [[black leotard]] and [[black pantyhose]] or a [[bodystocking]] worn under a [[double-breasted]] [[white shirt]] and [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]], [[black gloves]], and black [[wide sleeves]]. Her new carrier [[rigging]] consists of two mechanical hull pieces with 120 mm twin gun mounts and a split [[flight deck]] materializing out of a [[phoenix]] familiar. 

h4. Skins
h6. Note: Her dress skin cannot be used on Amagi-BC.

title: rice_wine
body: "Sweet rice wine made by mixing steamed glutinous rice (sticky rice) with jiuqu (a type of special microbial yeast) for fermentation. The brewing process is simple, and it has a fragrant and mellow taste. It has a long history of over a thousand years in China."

title: help:upload_rules
body:
All uploads to Danbooru are subject to the following upload rules. Uploads that break these rules may be deleted.

h6. Prohibited Content

You may not upload any of the following to Danbooru:

* [[Off-topic]] content (see below).
* Poorly drawn content.
* [[Paid reward]]s.
* Commercially licensed anime or manga.
* Real [[photo (medium)|]]s of any person under the age of 18.
* Works containing [[third-party watermark]]s (unless the unwatermarked picture is not available anywhere).
* Works [[upscaled]] or [[downscaled]] by third parties, including [[Waifu2x]] upscales (unless the original picture is not available anywhere).
* Hard translations to non-English languages ([[hard-translated (non-english)]]). The only exception is posts for which the original is not available anywhere.
* [[Third-party edit]]s that substantially alter the content of the image, such as [[nude filter]]s, [[headshop]]s, [[fake translation]]s, or meme or joke edits.
* Low effort or unoriginal memes, such as [[motivator (meme)|]]s (if not done by the original artist).
* Fully [[AI-generated]] art with no human input aside from prompting.

h6. Off-Topic Content

Danbooru is primarily for anime-style or anime-related artwork. "Anime-related" is a broad term that includes anime, manga, videogames, original artwork, and other similar material.

The following things are considered off-topic:

* Real life pornographic photos or videos, such as Western porn actresses or Japanese [[JAV]] idols.
* Real life photos that have nothing to do with anime, manga, or videogames.
* Low effort or unoriginal memes.

h6. Borderline Content

The following things are not strictly against the rules, but they have a much higher chance of being deleted than normal. Uploaders should be careful about uploading these things, and approvers should be careful about approving them.

* Extreme fetish content. This includes extreme [[guro]], [[scat]], [[bestiality]], [[vore]], "hyper" fetishism (monstrously large body parts), [[diaper]] fetishism, and other extreme or unusual fetishes.
* [[AI-assisted]] content. This includes works that were initially generated by AI but were considerably retouched by human effort.
** If you are unsure if your post qualifies as either [[AI-generated]] or [[AI-assisted]], you can try asking in topic #22285.
* Explicit [[furry]] content.
* [[3D]] porn or SFM porn.
* [[Cosplay photo]]s.
* [[Hard-translated]] comics.
* [[Anime screenshot]]s.
* [[Third-party edit]]s not in the "Prohibited Content" section above.
* [[Duplicate]]s.
* [[Bad anatomy]].

h4. See also

* [[help:community rules]]
* "Terms of Service":/terms_of_service

title: awaria
body:
A short indie bullet hell/task manager game created by Polish developer [[vanripper]]. The full game is available for free on Steam, and can be comfortably beaten in about an hour and a half.

You take the roll of a tunnel runner. If the generators fail, it's your job to fix them. Check what's wrong, craft all the needed parts and deliver them. While avoiding safety violations and violent ghosts. 

The main character took the job for the main purpose of kissing ghosts.

title: diddy_kong
body:
A Kong introduced in [i][[Donkey Kong Country]][/i], and a frequent participant in [[Mario (series)|Mario]] spinoffs since [i]Mario Golf: Toadstool Tour[/i].

Nimble and acrobatic, he is [[Donkey Kong]]'s little buddy and most reliable adventuring friend of the Kong Family. [[Dixie Kong]] is his girlfriend. 

Recognizable by his trademark [[red headwear|red]] [[baseball cap]] that's usually [[print_headwear|printed]] with the [[Nintendo]] logo and his [[red shirt|red]] [[sleeveless shirt]] that has two yellow [[star (symbol)|stars]] [[print shirt|printed]] on them.

Diddy Kong would haphazardly be called Donkey Kong's nephew in early material on occasion, but modern official bios disregard this entirely.

h4. Official Art
* !post #7952730

title: no_one's_around_to_help_(meme)
body:
An error message from  [[Animal Crossing]]: Pocket Camp that appears when you're trying to request assistance to get into the quarry and either your friends list is empty or you've already requested from everyone on it.

Features the iconic dance from [[A Hat in Time]].

title: dixie_kong
body:
A member of the Kong Family introduced in [i][[Donkey Kong Country 2|Donkey Kong Country 2: Diddy's Kong Quest]][/i], and a very infrequent participant in [[Mario (series)|Mario]] spinoffs since [i][[Mario Superstar Baseball]][/i].

A lover of adventure, her most significant trait is her [[blonde_hair|blonde]] [[ponytail]] hair that is shaped like banana. It's used for attacking, picking up items and allows her to twirl in the air like a helicopter. 

She has [[green eyes]] with visible [[eyelashes]]. She wears blue [[sphere earrings|spherical earrings]], a [[pink shirt|pink]] [[sleeveless shirt]] that's [[tied_shirt|tied]] in the front and a [[pink headwear|pink]] [[beret]]. Her beret used to have the Rare Ltd logo but has since been removed, the same goes for her knee pads.

She is [[Diddy Kong]]'s girlfriend, [[Kiddy Kong]]'s cousin and  was [[Tiny Kong]]'s older sister.

title: funky_kong
body:
A Kong introduced in [i][[Donkey Kong Country]][/i], and a very infrequent participant in [[Mario (series)|Mario]] spinoffs since [i][[Mario Kart Wii]][/i]. 

[[Donkey Kong]]'s friend. A cool, laid back [[gorilla]] that is usually not too keen on adventuring, instead preferring to help the Kongs out without getting directly involved. 

He usually wears a [[white tank top]], [[blue shorts|blue]] [[denim shorts]] with [[cutoffs]] and a [[black belt]]. He also has [[sunglasses]] and a [[polka dot|polka dotted]] [[red bandana]].

He is a pilot and owns a variety of aircraft, like a multitude of [[airplane]]s.

title: gouqi
body: Goqi berries originate from China and are native to the northwest region of China. They are a nutritious and health-promoting vegetable with medicinal properties, valued in traditional Chinese medicine.

title: gandalf
body:
Wizard character from [[the Lord of the Rings]] and other associated works in J.R.R. Tolkien's [[Tolkien's legendarium]].

[spoiler]Actually an embodied Maiar spirit, i.e. the LotR version of an angel, descended in human form.[/spoiler]

[[Ian McKellen]] portrayed Gandalf in The Lord of the Rings film series directed by Peter Jackson, after Sean Connery and [[Patrick Stewart]] both turned down the role.

title: aragorn
body: Aragorn (Sindarin: [ˈaraɡorn]) is a fictional character and a protagonist in J. R. R. Tolkien's [[The Lord of the Rings]]. Aragorn is a Ranger of the North, first introduced with the name Strider and later revealed to be the heir of Isildur, an ancient King of Arnor and Gondor. Aragorn is a confidant of the wizard [[Gandalf]] and plays a part in the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord [[Sauron]]. As a young man, Aragorn falls in love with the immortal elf [[Arwen]], as told in "The Tale of Aragorn and Arwen". Arwen's father, Elrond Half-elven, forbids them to marry unless Aragorn becomes King of both Arnor and Gondor.

title: biker_peach
body:
An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Princess Peach]] starting in [[Mario Kart Wii]], putting her in [[biker clothes]]. She wears a [[white jumpsuit]] with [[pink gloves|pink]] [[elbow gloves]] and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[knee boots]]. She also has her hair up in a [[ponytail]], along with a [[pink scarf]], a [[pink belt]], and her usual [[brooch]] in the center.

The outfit is slightly different in [[The Super Mario Bros. Movie]], with her now having a [[white_helmet|white]] [[motorcycle helmet]], her knee boots and gloves having a slightly different design, a visible front [[zipper]], and her bodysuit losing the pink pattern. She also gains a bit armor with visible [[shoulder pads|shoulder]] and [[knee pads]].

title: uncongealed_tofu
body: Uncongealed tofu (豆腐脑) is a famous traditional dish in China. It is a highly nutritious food made from soybean protein, often sold in the morning, and is commonly combined with tofu flower and douhua. The taste varies by region; people in northern China tend to prefer savory flavors, while those in southern China favor sweet tastes. In some regions, such as Sichuan, there is also a preference for sour and spicy flavors.

title: portable_stove
body:
A [[stove|cooking stove]] that is designed to be portable and lightweight. They are used in [[camping]], [[picnic|picnicking]], and for other uses in remote locations where there is no other means of heating or cooking.  In low-end Japanese apartments their kitchens may be furnished with a portable 1-3 burner stove that hooks to the gas line.

Portable stoves are frequently used for cooking [[hotpot]]s.

h4. Types

* !post #7153815: [[Backpacking stove]] 
* !post #7082647:  Kitchen countertop stove 
* !post #7011701: Countertop gas cartridge stove 
* !post #5230109:  Wood burning stove 

h4.See also

* [[Alcohol burner]]
* [[Bunsen burner]]
* [[Hot plate]] (Electric portable stove or griddle)
* [[Grill]]
** [[Shichirin]]

title: black_jewel
body:
Main antagonist and final boss of [i][[Wario World]][/i]. 

An evil sentient [[gem|jewel]] that was locked away in ancient ruins, but [[Wario]] stole it thinking it was treasure, allowing it to reawaken and destroy Wario's Castle while transforming his treasures into monsters.

Despite it's namesake it's color is [[purple_gemstone|purple]]. It has a [[one-eyed|single eye]] and numerous [[tentacles]].

title: mufasa
body: Mufasa is a major character in Disney's 1994 animated feature film [[The Lion King]]. He was a large, powerful [[lion]] who once served as king of the Pride Lands. Revered as a wise and noble leader, Mufasa dedicated his reign to upholding the “circle of life” and mentoring his only son, [[Simba]], to someday assume the throne. Mufasa’s younger brother, [[Scar (the lion king)|]], was secretly envious of the king and orchestrated a regicidal coup to steal the throne. Despite his death, Mufasa endures in the memories of his loved ones. His spirit manifests in clouds, stars, and sunlight, which has occasionally appeared to guide his descendants.

title: youtiao
body: Youtiao(油条) is an ancient type of noodle food, a long, hollow fried snack that is crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. It is one of the traditional breakfast foods in China.

title: soy_milk
body: Soybean milk, a traditional drink of the Han nationality in China, was first made by Liu An, the King of Huainan during the Western Han Dynasty. It is made by soaking soybeans in water, grinding them, filtering, and boiling the mixture.

title: bismarck_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the German battleship [i]Bismarck[/i]. Character design by [[Hao (patinnko)|]], voiced by [[Fukuhara Ayaka]]. 

She is portrayed with [[blue eyes]] and [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]]. Her normal outfit consists of a black [[military uniform]] with [[German flag print|German flag accents]] on her skirt, while her [[peaked cap]] is accented with symbols of the German Empire. She also wears a [[fur_trim|fur-trimmed]] [[cape]] and a pair of fur-trimmed [[black_footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]]. Her [[Bismarck (coat of arms)|coat-of-arms]] is displayed on her left shoulder, and like her sister Tirpitz, she carries a [[flag|pennant]].

She was present in the game since its beginning, serving as the boss for the tutorial. In May 2019, as part of Azur Lane's second anniversary, she was formally introduced as a playable character in the [i]Scherzo of Iron and Blood[/i] event. The announcement of her addition to the game also happened to coincide with the release of the song [i]"Bismarck":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oVWEb-At8yc&vl=en-US][/i] by the Swedish [[power metal]] band, [[sabaton (band)|Sabaton]], leading to Azur Lane's official English twitter account "quoting the opening lyrics to the song":[https://twitter.com/AzurLane_EN/status/1126879577207271424] as a hint to her addition to the game.

title: kiana_kaslana_(don_quijote)
body:
An [[official alternate costume]] of [i][[Honkai Impact 3rd]][/i]'s [[Kiana Kaslana]] for the Japan-exclusive [[Don Quijote (store)|]] collab. 

It consists of a white [[cable knit]] [[aran sweater]] worn with a [[red capelet]], [[black hat|black]] [[beret]], [[red bow]] on the capelet, [[black skirt]], and [[white pantyhose]]. She may or may not be portrayed in her [[Kiana Kaslana (Herrscher of Finality)|Herrscher of Finality]] form as is the case in the official promo art.

title: orgasm
body:
Sexual climax, a physiological and neurological response to sexual stimulation. It results in feelings of intense physical pleasure, release, and usually calm. During orgasm, men usually [[ejaculation|ejaculate]] [[cum|semen]] from the tip of their [[penis]]. Women usually produce an amount of liquid from their vaginal opening, and may also on occasion [[female_ejaculation|ejaculate]].

Tag applicable when it is apparent within an image that a character, usually a female, is experiencing an orgasm. This is usually shown most through the facial expression. 

h4. Examples

* post #228382

title: girthy_penis
body:
Describes the [[penis]]'s width, in which the shaft area appears thicker than average. This trait is usually associated with manliness and is desirable because it gives a sense of "fullness" during [[sex]].

Use this tag when the shaft of the penis appears similar or thicker in width to the head (tip, glans) of the penis.
Use with [[veiny penis]] when appropriate.

title: dark_penis

title: micro_shorts
body:
A pair of [[shorts]] that are so small that they could easily be mistaken for panties.

Micro shorts can be both regular outerwear or an undergarment. They are also sometimes worn as [[bikini shorts]].

As underwear, they can be worn over panties as loungewear, as [[shorts_under_skirt|undershorts]] under a skirt, or as shorts-shape underpants directly in lieu of [[panties]]. As panty alternative, micro shorts are usually known as "boyshorts".

If the leg parts are very short but loose it should probably be [[short shorts]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[bloomers]]
* [[dolphin shorts]]
* [[short shorts]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: harambe
body: A 17-year-old western lowland [[gorilla]] who lived at the Cincinnati Zoo. He gained attention on May 2016 when a young child accidently fell into his exhibit, in which his zookeepers decided to fatally shoot Harambe to ensure the safety of the child. His death sparked both outrage and humor in the form of [[meme|internet memes]].

body:

Named due to its upright brim resembling the brand name disposable paper cup, and external shape is roughly inverted trapezoid. The USN version is all [[white headwear|white]], but many have a stripe or stripes on the brim.

title: harran_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

She is a member of [[Inherit (nikke)|]], Pilgrims hailing from Eden, a highly advanced settlement located in a remote part of the Surface. Harran serves as the chemical warfare specialist among the three.

Members of Inherit are named after Biblical figures; Harran is named after "Haran":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haran], a brother of Abraham.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and [[blue eyes]] with [[large breasts]] and [[mole under eye|mole under her eye]]. Her outfit consists of an [[highleg leotard|highleg]] [[armored leotard]], [[mechanical horns]], [[thigh boots|thigh]] [[armored boots]], and [[bridal gauntlets]]. Often depicted wielding a [[scythe]].

Illustrator: [[Yoya Yogurt]]

h4.Outfits
* [[Harran (Banquet Witch) (Nikke)|Banquet Witch]]

title: modernia_(nikke)
body:
A character from [[Goddess of Victory: NIKKE]]. A member of the Queen's elite squad, the [[Heretics_(nikke)|]].

[spoilers]She is [[Marian (nikke)|]]'s current form, having been recovered and repaired by Rapture forces following her apparent euthanization.[/spoilers]

After engaging the Counters several times, she would be purged of her corruption through a substance known as "Vapaus". However, the Rapture "Chatterbox" in its dying moments would force a hard mental reset which left Modernia in a toddler-like mental state, [spoilers]though she still remains fond of the word "Commander"[/spoilers]. She is currently being taken care of by the [[Pioneer (nikke)|]] Pilgrims while on the run from Ark authorities, who hope to cut her up and reverse-engineer the Rapture technology within her body.

She has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with [[sidelocks]], wearing [[bandaged head|bandages on her head]]. She's a [[mecha musume]] wearing [[armor]] and a [[bodysuit]], showing her [[large breasts]]. Wears [[black gloves|black]] [[armored gloves|armored]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[shoulder armor]], a [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[hair ribbon]], [[armored boots|armored]] [[high heel boots]], and is usually carrying her [[submachine gun]]. She also has a [[mechanical tail]].

Illustrator: [[KKUEM]]

h4. Official Art

title: war_hammer
body:
A late [[medieval]] weapon of war originally intended for close combat action. It was designed to deliver heavy damage against well-armored opponents through sheer blunt force. Though some adapted it as a versatile [[polearm]] weapon instead by giving it a longer handle.

Real life war hammers are comparable in size with a regular carpentry [[hammer]], though with a longer handle and often a spike opposite the blunt head to pierce armor. This tag can also be applied to [[huge_weapon|huge]] fantasy [[weapon|weapons]] depicted simply as an oversized [[hammer]]/[[sledgehammer]].

Not to be confused with [[Warhammer 40k]].

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]
* [[Polehammer]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: War hammer":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_hammer]

h4. See also

title: flail
body:
The flail is a medieval [[weapon]], made of (one or more) weight(s) attached to a handle with a hinge, [[rope]], or short [[chain]]. They originated from farming flails, which were used to thresh grain.

A rule of thumb, if the weapon has a chain over an arm's length (and more so over 1.5 arm's lengths), then the weapon is most likely a [[ball and chain (weapon)|]] instead. 

h4. See also

title: yuki_miku_(2014)
body:
"Magical Snow"

The 2014 version of [[Yuki Miku]]. The theme of the design contest for this year was "magical girl" with the image of Hokkaido winter and snow. The winning entry was done by [[dera fury]], featuring a magician design with a large white [[witch hat]], white [[cloak]], purple [[fingerless gloves]], and a [[snow globe]] [[wand]].

Her fan nickname is "Namara-chan".

This year marked the 5th anniversary of Snow Miku. She was the first Snow Miku to receive an official theme song: "[[Suki! Yuki! Maji Magic (Vocaloid)|Suki! Yuki! Maji Magic]]" by Mitchie M. A pet design contest for Snow Miku was held as well, with the winner being [[Rabbit Yukine]].

Hermione began attending Hogwarts in 1991 and was Sorted into Gryffindor House. She possessed a brilliant academic mind and proved to be a gifted student in almost every subject that she studied, to the point where she was nearly made a Ravenclaw by the Sorting Hat.

title: arabesque_(pose)
body:
A common position in [[ballet]] in which the dancer [[standing on one leg|stands on one leg]] (the [i]supporting[/i] leg) with the other leg (the [i]working[/i] leg) [[leg up|elevated]] and extended behind the body, and both legs held straight. 

An arabesque can be executed with the supporting leg [[en pointe]], demi pointe, or with foot flat on the floor. The elevation angles of the working leg is commonly around 45° and 90°, but higher or lower is allowed, and the leg can be raised as high as 180° (in which case the [[standing split]] tag should also be added). 
The arms may be held in various positions, usually [[spread arms]] or one [[arm up]]. 

h4.Examples 
* !post #6111706
* !post #5281847

h4.See also

[[Attitude_(pose)|]]

title: melody_lane_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Named after a [[Camellia]] cultivar.[/tn]
Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Orfevre (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Mowen. She is a bay mare with a wide blaze marking that is slanted over the left side of her face, socks on all but her front left leg and is notable for being unusually small as well as being [[Titleholder (racehorse)|]]'s elder sister.

This diminutive thoroughbred is famous for having the record as the JRA's lightest winner of a race - at 338 kg - and usually hovers around 350 kg. Most of her fellow competitors as well as both parents (in their racing years, both were around 450 and 460 kg) are at least a full 100 kg heavier than her. While not a top-level runner, she actually has modest success as a Stayer (a long-distance runner) and is renowned for her exceptional stamina. Her first win was at a 2400 m race, her other wins being above that distance and her only Classics appearence being a respectable 5th place at the Kikuka Sho (3000 m. Two years later, Titleholder would win that race). After a long career running in many of Japan's longest races, Melody Lane retired on December 2024 at age 8 due to a bowed tendon. She returned to Okada Stud to assume broodmare duties.

Unsurprisingly, being an idol horse, she is a popular choice for [[horse girl|original]] [[Umamusume]], often depicted together with her RL sire Orfevre (either in her [[orfevre (old design) (umamusume)|old design]] or in her [[orfevre_(umamusume)|canon version]]) or a umamusume version of Titleholder. She is usually represented this way with brown hair with a wide blaze marking making the left side of her bangs, an ornament based on her namesake flower or a musical note ([i]Melody[/i] Lane) on or around [b]her left ear[/b], and is typically portrayed as much smaller than most other characters.

title: alkaid_mcgrath_(spirit_world)
body:
[[Lovebrush Chronicles]] character. [[Alkaid McGrath]]’s alternate self in the Spirit World. Lord of the Forest and Spirit Lord of the Third Era, creator of the Sky City and the Circle of Earth. A Deer Spirit whose particular origin makes him immune to the Corruption, he has dedicated himself to reverse the spread of the corrupted forest and protect the Spirit World.

He wears a [[see-through clothes|see-through]] [[open robe|open]] [[white robe]] and [[white shorts]], alongside [[head chain]], [[gold necklace]], [[gold earrings]], [[bracer]], and [[anklet]]. He has [[deer antlers]] and stays [[barefoot]]. His animal form is a white [[deer]].

title: alkaid_mcgrath_(eden)
body:
[[Lovebrush Chronicles]] character. [[Alkaid McGrath]]’s alternate self in the Eden. He is a mysterious gardener who insists on bringing the [[heroine (lovebrush chronicles)|]] to his home for a cup of tea. His true identity is the Master of Eden, master of the [[monster]]s known as “the Lost” and mastermind behind the battle royale. 

He wears either a [[white suit]], or a [[science fiction]]-esque outfit with [[puff and slash sleeves]] and [[white cloak]]. He’s associated with [[white rose]] and [[tea]].

title: clarence_clayden_(awakening)
body:
[[Lovebrush Chronicles]] character, Modern World’s [[Clarence Clayden]] in an alternate future shown in Awakening Chapter. He is Clarence-04D-4711, a Type 04-D [[Android]], who is awakened from a hibernation chamber a hundred year after Earth’s fall with his memory hazy of who he really is.

He has [[short hair]] and wears a [[black jacket]] and a [[scouter]].

title: clarence_clayden_(spirit_world)
body:
[[Lovebrush Chronicles]] character, [[Clarence Clayden]]’s alternate self in Spirit World. Lord of the Wind, formerly Lord of the Sea, and the first Spirit Lord to ever ascend. Being the one the Caelum Tower originated from, he knows all about its secrets, but prefers to remain silent and uninvolved in the grand scheme after having witnessed three circles of apocalypse.

He has [[long hair]] in a [[single braid]] and wears a [[white robe]], [[black cape]], [[black gloves]], [[gold necklace]], [[gold earrings]], and a [[monocle]]. There’re [[black horns]] on one side of his head. His animal form is a [[oversized animal|giant]] [[winged animal|feathered]] [[white snake]] inspired by Quetzalcoatls. His symbol is the [[infinity symbol]] or the [[mobius strip]].

title: clarence_clayden_(eden)
body:
[[Lovebrush Chronicles]] character, [[Clarence Clayden]]’s alternate self in Eden. He is a NEOS with augmented senses, serving as a freelance mercenary and hailed as “the strongest NEOS in the desert”. He was the first NEOS the [[heroine (lovebrush chronicles)|]] met who guided her to Eden and also entered it later for what he called a "sightseeing trip", but isn’t interested in joining the battle royale himself. 

He has [[short hair]] and notably wears a [[white shirt]], [[bulletproof vest]], dark [[blue coat]], and a pair of [[orange-tinted eyewear]]. He primarily wields a [[sniper rifle]] in battle alongside various [[gun]]s, and rides a [[motorcycle]]. His motif is the [[falcon]].

body:

Received an anime adaptation for the Winter 2017 season. Eventually collected enough supporting characters in the junior class that they got a spinoff manga, Tapris Sugar Step.

h5. List of characters

* [[Gabriel Tenma White]] / Gab
* [[Vignette Tsukinose April]] / Vigne

title: pitcher_(container)
body:
A container with a handle and spout that allows [[water]] or other liquids to be easily poured into a [[cup]] or a [[drinking glass]].

A small pitcher used to hold condiments is a [[creamer (vessel)|]].

Used for serving drinks, not [[pitching|throwing baseballs]].

Not to be confused with a [[jug (bottle)|]].

"A 'jug' is a large bottle":[https://i.imgur.com/6I5tu69.png] (like the plastic gallon jugs used for milk or the older glass gallon jugs used for cider or fruit juice). Examples: post #4657026, post #2931700.

"A pitcher":[https://i.imgur.com/echI4pG.jpg] is a large open mouthed container for pouring drinks, it's a dish itself, not something you'd buy from the store. Examples: post #2625448, post #1801140. The [[Kool-Aid Man]] (post #113823) is a walking talking pitcher.

title: sa-x
body:
The [b]SA-X[/b] (short for [b]Samus Aran-X[/b]) is the main antagonist of Metroid Fusion.

The SA-X is an [[X Parasite]] mimicking [[Samus Aran]]. After Samus's first encounter with the X on SR388, her [[Power Suit]] was infected by the parasites. The Galactic Federation surgically removed infected portions of her suit and sent the pieces to the Biologic Space Laboratories research station's Quarantine Bay. Once there, the X inside the infected suit parts seemingly combined and transformed into a copy of Samus in her standard [[Varia Suit]].

* !asset #23453199: Visor close-up
* !asset #23453200: Transformation [tn](Mirrored sprite)[/tn]

title: chou_shittou_caduceus
body:
[b]Chou Shittou Caduceus[/b] (lit. "Super Surgical Operation Caduceus"), localized as [b]Trauma Center[/b], is a series of arcade-puzzle/visual novel games in which players assume the role of a surgeon in a fictional hospital setting to strive to save their patients from a pathological condition such as disease or injury using surgical instruments, suturing, and the "Healing Touch" (a fictional superhuman ability). A recurring theme throughout the series is the protagonist's trials of treating bioterrorism victims. These games are designed to make use of the Nintendo DS' touch screen and the Wii's Motion sensing and pointing features, being exclusively released on those systems.

h4. See also

* [[Hospital Rokunin no Ishi|Trauma Team]]

title: spawn_(spawn)
body:
The titular character of [[Spawn (comic)|]].

Albert "Al" Francis Simmons was born in Detroit, Michigan as the second of three brothers (Marc, Al and Richard) to Esther and Bernard Simmons. Simmons was a very gifted officer of the United States Marine Corps, where he attained the rank of Lieutenant Colonel. He later joined the United States Secret Service, which led to his transfer to the Central Intelligence Agency. In the CIA, Simmons was recruited by Director Jason Wynn into a special top-secret covert ops division known as the U.S. Security Group, an elite task force with jurisdiction in all domestic and foreign situations.

Jason Wynn (the director of the CIA) and Simmons began to butt heads more often and Simmons planned to resign.

Simmons was murdered during a mission in Botswana for the USSG's Operation Knightstrike by fellow mercenary Bruce Stinson (aka Chapel) at the order of Director Wynn. Simmons was sent to [[Hell]] because of his life as an assassin. After arranging a deal with the being known as Malebolgia, Simmons agrees to become a Hellspawn in exchange for being allowed to see his wife Wanda Blake one last time.

Spawn was played by Michael Jai White in the 1997 live action Spawn movie while in the Spawn HBO animated series, he is voiced by Keith David.

title: loki_(fire_emblem)
body:
Loki is an antagonist from [[Fire Emblem Heroes]]. She is first introduced by apparently disguising herself as Bruno, Anna, Alfonse, and Sharena. She initially keeps her true form hidden, but appears as her true self in Book II of the main story. Capricious, sultry and playful, Loki shows a consistent inclination toward chaos, with her true motivations remaining unknown.

In reality, Loki is a goddess who serves [[Alfathor (Fire Emblem)|Alfaðör]], the creator god of the setting, together with her sister [[Thorr (Fire Emblem)|Thórr]].

After a long absence, she returns in Book IX with [[Loki (Trickster God) (Fire Emblem)|a new design]], which had previously been introduced in April 2024 for her Mythic alt.

title: steak_tartare
body: A dish consisting of raw minced or ground beef mixed with various seasonings and often topped with an egg yolk. While the tag refers to the French name of the dish, other cultures have similar versions of the dish, such as German [i]mett[/i], or Korean [i]yukhoe[/i].

title: armet
body: A type of [[helmet]] that appeared in the 15th and 16th Centuries and was used extensively in Italy, France, England, Spain, and the Low Countries (consisting of Belgium, Luxembourg, and the Netherlands). Completely enclosing the head, an armet consists of the skull, a double-pivoted [[visor]] and two hinged cheek pieces which lock at the front over the chin. Considered an evolution of the earlier [[bascinet]].

title: studio_ghibli
body:
Studio Ghibli is an iconic Japanese animation studio that has produced many successful films over the years.

Founded by [[Miyazaki Hayao]], [[Suzuki Toshio]], [[Takahata Isao]] (1935-2018), and [[Tokuma Yasuyoshi]] (1921-2000), this core group of collaborators has overseen the direction and production of much of the studio's creative output. Other notable staff include [[Anno Hideaki]], [[Kousaka Kitarou]], [[Andou Masashi]], [[Yamashita Akihiko]], [[Futaki Makiko]] (1958-2016), and [[Yoshida Ken'ichi]].

Following the retirement of Miyazaki in 2014, Studio Ghibli temporarily halted all production of feature-length works until 2017, with the announcement of Miyazaki's return to direct the film [i]How Do You Live?[/i], which released in 2023.

h4. Films (Year, English title)

* [[Kaze no Tani no Nausicaa]] (1984, Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind)
** Note that while this movie was animated by Top Craft before Studio Ghibli's foundation in 1985, it is considered the first Ghibli movie.
* [[Tenkuu no Shiro Laputa]] (1986, Laputa: Castle in the Sky)
* [[Hotaru no Haka]] (1988, Grave of the Fireflies)
* [[Tonari no Totoro]] (1988, My Neighbour Totoro)
* [[Majo no Takkyuubin]] (1989, Kiki's Delivery Service)
* [[Omohide Poro Poro]] (1991, Only Yesterday)
* [[Kurenai no Buta]] (1992, Porco Rosso)
* [[Umi ga Kikoeru]] (1993, Ocean Waves / I Can Hear the Sea)
* [[Heisei Tanuki Gassen Ponpoko]] (1994, Pom Poko)
* [[Mimi wo Sumaseba]] (1995, Whisper of the Heart)
* [[On Your Mark]] (1995) (music video)
* [[Mononoke Hime]] (1997, Princess Mononoke)
* [[Houhokekyo Tonari no Yamada-kun]] (1999, My Neighbours the Yamadas)
* [[Sen to Chihiro no Kamikakushi]] (2001, Spirited Away)
* [[Neko no Ongaeshi]] (2002, The Cat Returns)
* [[Howl no Ugoku Shiro]] (2004, Howl's Moving Castle)
* [[Gedo Senki]] (2006, Tales from Earthsea)
* [[Gake no Ue no Ponyo]] (2008, Ponyo)
* [[Karigurashi no Arrietty]] (2010, The Borrower Arietty / The Secret World of Arietty)
* [[Kokurikozaka Kara]] (2011, From Up on Poppy Hill)
* [[Kaze Tachinu]] (2013, The Wind Rises)
* [[Kaguya-hime no Monogatari]] (2013, The Tale of the Princess Kaguya)
* [[Omoide no Marnie]] (2014, When Marnie Was There)
* [[Kemushi no Boro]] (2015, Boro the Caterpillar) (short)
* [[Aaya to Majo]] (2020, Earwig and the Witch)
* [[Kimitachi wa Dou Ikiru ka]] (2023, How Do You Live? / The Boy and the Heron)

* "Wikipedia":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Studio_Ghibli

title: sallet
body:
A type of [[helmet]] worn in 15th Century Europe, evolving from the earlier [[bascinet]] and into the later [[armet]] and close helms.

Sallets are characterized by "tails" of varying length to protect the back of the neck. They may or may not have visors, which can be hinged or a solid part of the helmet.

title: ushiromiya_lion
body:
Character from [[Umineko no Naku Koro Ni]]. 

Lion is the 19-year-old [[androgynous]] child of [[ushiromiya krauss|Krauss]] and [[ushiromiya natsuhi| Natsuhi]], and older sibling of [[ushiromiya jessica|Jessica]] who only exists in an alternate world shown in [i]Requiem of the golden witch[/i]. Lion is the first in line of succession to the headship of the Ushiromiya family. Teams up with [[Willard H. Wright]] to solve the mystery set down by [[frederica bernkastel|Bernkastel]].

[spoiler][[Frederica bernkastel|Bernkastel]] has stated that Lion's existence is an almost impossible chance; in every other timeline, Natsuhi shoved an infant Lion and the servant carrying him off a cliff. Even though he survived, various other circumstances in the other timelines resulted in the character [[yasu (umineko)|Sayo Yasuda]].[/spoiler]

It has been all but been confirmed that Lion's true gender is "male":[http://umineko.wikia.com/wiki/Lion_Ushiromiya#Trivia], making them a [[Bishounen]] and/or [[Otoko no Ko]].

title: stephen_quire
body: Stephen Quire is the main character of the [[Greatest Freakout Ever]], who was recorded by his brother in a freakout after his mom cancelled his [[World of Warcraft]] account. One of the most notable moments of his freakout is when he attempts to shove a tv remote up his butt. This moment is still referenced by fans of the series in comments like "At least he didn't shove *insert object* up his butt!".

body:
The [[Dolphin]]s of [[Super Mario World]] are blue-skinned sea creatures which wear diver's [[goggles]]. They are very friendly, refusing to attack [[Mario]] and even allowing him to ride on their backs. They live on the surface of the ocean, where they constantly jump in and out of the water.

In the Japanese version of Super Mario World they were named Lifton.

title: victorious_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the HMS [i]HMS Victorious[/i], an aircraft carrier of the Royal Navy.

She has [[very long hair|very long]], [[blonde hair]] with [[blue eyes]]. Adorning her head is a golden [[laurel crown]]/[[head wreath]]. She wears a long [[white dress|white]], [[sleeveless dress]] with a [[center opening]], with [[gold chain]]s under her [[large breasts]] and a [[halterneck]] topped with a [[blue rose]]. She also wears [[black thighhighs|black]], [[stirrup legwear|stirrup]] with [[gold trim]] around the thighs, and has golden [[wrist ribbon]]s. 

Her [[rigging]] is composed of [[ship turret]]s attached to her waist and a golden [[staff]] with a [[flight deck]] attacked like a flag.

Character design by [[Kaede (Yumesaki Kaede)|]], voiced by [[Nakamura Eriko]].

title: z2_georg_thiele_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the German destroyer Z2 [i]Georg Thiele[/i] in [[Azur Lane]]. 

She is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] dark [[brown hair|brown]]/[[black hair]] with an [[ahoge]] and multiple [[braid]]s, and [[red eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[white shirt]] and [[white skirt]] worn under a [[blue capelet]] with an [[aiguillette]] and [[Iron Cross]] badge, [[blue hat|blue]] [[beret]] with a second Iron Cross, [[pouch]] on her right waist, [[bike shorts]], [[black socks|black kneehighs]], and [[red footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a 12.8 cm single gun mount to her left and 533 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]] to her right.

title: z1_leberecht_maass_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the German destroyer Z1 [i]Leberecht Maass[/i] in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Saru]], voiced by [[Takamori Natsumi]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] tied in a [[side ponytail]] to her right, and [[pink eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a two-tone [[double-breasted]] [[military uniform]] top with an [[Iron Cross]] tied to an [[aiguillette]] and longer sides colored red on the inner side, a red [[armband]] with an Iron Cross print, [[white belt]], [[black shorts]], blue [[kneehighs]] with [[legwear garter]], and the usual [[rudder footwear]].

Her rig is animalistic, typical of Ironblood faction, with 533 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on her left and two 12.7 cm single gun mounts to her right, linked together by a bridge structure and mast to her back. Her guns also have an [[ammunition belt]]. She can control her rig by way of two [[joystick]]s, one on each side.

title: anilive
body:
Vertical-streaming platform designed for [[virtual YouTuber]]s founded by former [[Prism Project]] CEO Captain. Its mascot is [[Ailis (anilive)|]], a singing [[android]]. Other secondary mascots include Eliot (a [[wolf]]), D.D. (a [[rabbit]]) and Silentman (a [[ghost]]). Some of its mascots appear in AniLive's gifts.

In July 2024, they started applications for their [[anilive jumpstart program|jumpstart program]].

On December 17, 2024, AniLive announced that they would go on a transition period to rebuild their platform starting on February 1, 2025. Users would no longer be able to download the app starting on that date. While it isn't a complete shutdown, it would return at an unknown date.

title: fjalar_(fire_emblem)
body:
Background character from [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War]].

Fjalar is one of the Twelve Crusaders who liberated Jugdral from the tyranny of Emperor Gair and the Loptrian Church. She wields the holy fire tome [[Valflame]], which has since been passed down to her descendants. After the Miracle of Dahna, where she is presumed to have entered a blood-bond with a Fire Dragon named Salamander, and the fall of the Loptrian Empire, she founded House Velthomer in the northeastern lands of the Kingdom of Grannvale, neighboring the Kingdom of Isaach.

Fjalar's descendants, who carry her Holy Blood, include the following. Bearers of major blood are indicated in bold:
* [b]Victor[/b]
** [b][[Arvis (Fire Emblem)|Arvis]][/b]
*** [b][[Saias (Fire Emblem)|Saias]][/b]
*** [[Julius (Fire Emblem)|Julius]]
*** [[Julia (Fire Emblem)|Julia]]
** [[Azelle (Fire Emblem)|Azelle]]
* [[Hilda (Fire Emblem)|Hilda]]
** [[Ishtore (Fire Emblem)|Ishtore]] (does not have minor Fjalar blood in-game)
** [[Ishtar (Fire Emblem)|Ishtar]] (does not have minor Fjalar blood in-game)

title: nude_guy_wrapped_in_ribbons_standing_(meme)
body:
On December 6th, 2024, Twitter user "@drioicon":[https://twitter.com/i/user/1159797750055129090] "re-posted":[https://x.com/drioicon/status/1864853965604897147] an old digitally altered image by BuiltByTallSteve of a nude [[muscular male]] standing wrapped in ribbons. The image has become viral receiving over 100k likes and has been used as a [[reference photo]] by [[bara]] artists.
"Another post":[https://x.com/briarthornss/status/1865696325842448568] featuring the same image by "@briarthornss":[https://twitter.com/i/user/1382388709891444736] was posted on December 8th, 2024 and also became viral.

The origin of the image is unknown.

h4. Examples

title: ayano_aishi
body:
[i]"Yandere-chan [b]is not[/b] a good person. She's a monster."[/i] -- YandereDev


[b]Ayano Aishi[/b], also known as [b]Yandere-chan[/b] or [b]Yan-chan[/b], is the title character and protagonist from the sandbox game [[Yandere Simulator]]. Originally stated to be a normal girl until [[Info-chan]] gave her the idea to kill her rivals, she has since been stated to be somewhat of a sociopath who was only able to feel some sort of emotion the first time she met her [[Senpai_(yandere_simulator)|Senpai]]. She has stalked the object of her desires since then, and is known to harm anyone who gets in her way.

She has [[black hair]] in a [[ponytail]] and [[black eyes]]. She is normally seen in a [[serafuku]] with [[black thighhighs]]. By option of the player, the character's appearance and gender can be customized.

h4. External links

* https://yanderedev.wordpress.com/2015/03/01/murder-reaction-and-cleanup/

title: yandere_simulator
body:
"[b]Yandere Simulator[/b] is a stealth game about stalking a boy and secretly eliminating any girl who seems interested in him, while maintaining the image of an innocent schoolgirl. ... The gameplay is similar to the [[hitman (game)|Hitman series]]; you are put into a large environment filled with many NPCs, and you must track down a specific target and eliminate them. You can use stealth to kill your target without any witnesses, stage an accident that leaves no evidence, or just slaughter anyone who gets in your way. If you don't dispose of corpses, clean up blood, and destroy evidence, then the police might be able to link you to a murder and arrest you." [1]

The game is notorious and often meme'd on for its long development cycle, primarily due to the fact that the developer YandereDev (Alex Mahan) often sidetracked his work to other things, such as streaming and [[virtual youtuber|vtubing]], as well as several controversies surrounding it. As such, the game is still under development as of date.

h4. Characters

[b]Note:[/b] The names of the characters are puns on anime culture and chosen for commonality, thus their names are not meant to be rendered in Eastern order. 

* Lead protagonists
** [[ayano aishi|Yandere-chan / Ayano Aishi]]
** [[Senpai (yandere simulator)|Senpai]]
** [[Info-chan]]

* Rivals
** [[Amai Odayaka]] (Cooking Club)
** [[Asu Rito]] (Sports Club)
** [[Hanako Yamada]] (Senpai's sister)
** [[Kizana Sunobu]] (Drama Club)
** [[Megami Saiko]] (Student Council)
** [[Muja Kina]] (School Nurse)
** [[Oka Ruto (Yandere Simulator)|Oka Ruto]] (Occult Club)
** [[Osana Najimi (Yandere Simulator)|Osana Najimi]] (Childhood friend)
** [[Osoro Shidesu]] (Delinquent)

* Student body 
** [[Inkyu Basu]]
** [[kokona haruka (yandere simulator)|Kokona Haruka]]
** [[Kuroko Kamenaga]]
** [[midori gurin (yandere simulator)|Midori Gurin]]
** [[Sakyu Basu]]
** [[supana churu (yandere simulator)|Supana Churu]]

title: miyuki_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Miyuki[/i]. Character designed by [[Hagi (ame Hagi)|]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] with grey ends and a hairstyle that [[hair over one eye|covers her left eye]], and [[yellow eyes]]. She also features [[fox ears]] and a very large [[fox tail]], all have grey ends. Her default outfit consists of a black [[bodysuit]], a [[white sailor collar]] with a blue [[neck ribbon]] and [[jingle bell]]s, a [[white coat]], [[bandages]] on her thighs and [[bandaged head|head]], a [[shinai]] as a melee weapon, and wears [[no socks]] [[platform footwear]]([[Okobo]]).

Her [[rigging]] consists of two 610 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]], one on each side, a 12.7 cm twin gun mount on her left, and a [[lantern]] on her right, all held together by a funnel piece to her back.

title: akatsuki_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Akatsuki[/i].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied in a [[ponytail]], and [[orange eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a white [[serafuku]] top styled in a [[midriff]], a [[black scarf]], a red [[obi]], a chest-less [[leotard]], [[knee boots]] with [[rudder footwear|a rudder accessory]], and [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] black [[elbow gloves]].

Most noticeable is her [[skull mask]] that covers her right eye, worn in a style similar to an [[Arrancar]].

Her rig consists of a single hull piece to her left/portside that contains a 12.7 cm twin mount Type B and a 61 cm triple torpedo launcher. She carries a second 12.7 twin gun mount to her right as a [[handgun]] and holds a torpedo like a [[kunai]] on her left. She also has a [[searchlight]] attached to an [[armband]] on her left arm.

title: ayanami_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Ayanami[/i]. Character design by [[Ootsuki Momiji]], voiced by [[Taichi You]]. 

She is a Japanese/Korean/Taiwan server-only starter ship, being replaced by [[Z23_(azur_lane)|]] in the English and Mainland Chinese servers. She is claimable after obtaining the other three starters.

She has light gray/[[blonde hair]], [[orange eyes|orange]] or [[red eyes]], and initially wears a modified [[serafuku|schoolgirl uniform]] and [[rudder footwear|rudder boots]], before her remodel switches her to an outfit with miko sleeves, a [[miniskirt]], loafer-type rudder footwear, and [[zettai ryouiki]]. Her clothes are short enough to expose her [[midriff]], and, in her retrofit, a fair amount of [[underboob]] as well.

Her [[rigging]] consists of a single 12.7 cm twin gun mount Type B to her left, a funnel-mast backpack on her back, a [[searchlight]] strapped to her belt on the left, and two 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]]. Upon retrofit, her searchlight and gun mount are remounted to the funnel backpack.

title: cocoa_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. 

A member of [[Maid For You (nikke)|]] along with [[Soda (Nikke)|]] and [[Ade (Nikke)|]]. The pampered youngest member and the Maid Leader of Maid For You. She works hard to complete her duties professionally. She has the habit of pouring ketchup on food.

She has [[yellow eyes|yellow]]/[[brown eyes]], [[small breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair|pink]]/[[red hair]], with [[sidelocks]], her [[hair between eyes]], and the hair tied with [[twintails]]. She also has [[multiple hair bows]]. She's a [[maid]] wearing typical apparel like a [[maid headdress]], a [[maid apron]] with [[frills]] and [[clothes writing]], a [[black bowtie]], [[black ribbon]], [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]], a [[satchel]], holding a [[ketchup bottle]]. She also wields an [[umbrella gun]].

Other: [[+ +]], [[hair ornament]], [[petticoat]], [[lolita fashion]], [[juliet sleeves]], [[:<]]

h4. Official Art
* !post #6029760: L2D

title: sada-chan_(tawawa)
body:
A character from [i][[Getsuyoubi no Tawawa]][/i] that parodies [[Yamamura Sadako]] from [i][[The Ring]][/i]. Her name comes from [[Himura Kiseki]]'s Twitter comments on the character.

Generally resembles Sadako, but with [[alternate breast size|much bigger breasts]] and apparently far less obsession with killing people, as she ceases to show such tendencies from her second appearance onward in favor of developing a possessive quasi-cohabitative relationship with the boy she's currently haunting.

According to [i]Getsuyoubi no Tawawa Sono VIII[/i], she was a popular child actress but "couldn't get a decent role" and got bullied at school after growing up due to her breast size. She died from accidentally falling into a well because of her heavy breasts during the filming of a low-budget [i]The Ring[/i] parody movie in 1998.

She collected many old game consoles and other electronic products from 1990s in the well like [[Super Famicom]], [[Game Boy]], [[Playstation 1]], [[Tamagotchi]] and Cassette boombox.

She has [[very long hair]], [[bangs]] that obscure her eyes, and wears a white [[robe]]. And as noted above, like other female characters in the series, she has [[large breasts]]. Recently, the author has stated she's the [[huge_breasts|largest]] of the current girls.

body:

body: The third ascension of [[Louhi (fate)|]] in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. In this ascension Louhi is older than she is in her first two ascensions, and is effectively a [[harpy]].

title: cael_anselm_(spirit_world)
body: [[Lovebrush Chronicles]]’s [[Cael Anselm]]’s [[official alternate costume]] in Spirit World: [[black coat]], [[white shirt]] and [[white pants|pants]], [[harness]], [[black hat|black]] [[peaked cap]], and [[white gloves]]. He is often seen wielding a [[scythe]].

title: cael_anselm_(godheim)
body:
[[Lovebrush Chronicles]]’s [[Cael Anselm]]’s [[official alternate costume]] in Godheim: [[white coat]] and [[white pants|pants]], [[black shirt]] with [[frilled shirt collar]], [[white belt]] with [[playing card theme]], and [[white gloves]]. 

In this attire, he is known as the “Silver Knight”, leader of the Rebellion who opposed [[Lars Rorschach (Godheim)|]]. He’s associated with [[butterfly]], [[snow]], and [[sword]].

title: ayn_alwyn_(godheim)
body:
[[Lovebrush Chronicles]] character, [[Ayn Alwyn]]’s alternate self in Godheim. He is crown prince of Godheim Empire, leader of the Inquisitors, and cousin of [[Lars Rorschach (Godheim)|]]. He wants to take revenge on Lars for killing his family, and would welcome the [[heroine (lovebrush chronicles)|]] as a powerful partner-in-crime. 

He is often depicted either in his [[formal clothes]] that is a [[black suit]] with [[black coat]] and [[white ascot]], or his Inquisitor uniform which has a [[black cloak|black]] [[hooded cloak]]. His signature accessory is a red [[single earring]], and he’s associated with [[sword]].

title: formal_clothes
body:
A scene characterised by characters wearing formal clothes such as [[suit]]s, [[dress shirt]]s, [[gown]]s, [[evening gown]]s, [[cocktail dress]]es, [[waistcoat]], [[pants]], and [[dress shoes]].

 Unless they truly give the formal vibe, [[business suit]] worn by salarymen and alike [b]shouldn’t[/b] be tagged with this. 

h4. See also
* [[tag group:fashion style]]

title: lars_rorschach_(godheim)
body:
[[Lovebrush Chronicles]] character, [[Lars Rorschach]]’s alternate self in Godheim. He is emperor of Godheim Empire who is known as a tyrant and cousin of [[Ayn Alwyn (Godheim)|]]. In the beginning, he forces the [[heroine (lovebrush chronicles)|]] to marry him after her summon for the Descendance Ritual.

He commonly wears a [[crown]] and a [[fur-trimmed coat|fur-trimmed]] [[white coat|white]] [[collared coat]]. He’s associated with the [[fleur-de-lis]] and the [[faberge egg]].

title: weavel
body: A [[Space Pirate (Metroid)|]] in the [[Metroid]] series who had most of hs body destroyed during a battle against [[Samus Aran]]. Only his brain and spinal cord survived, which were transferred into a huge cyborg body. Weavel is obsessed with hunting down and killing Samus for this.

title: rodion_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus Company]] character.

Sinner No.09 of [[Limbus Company]]. Named after and based off of the protagonist of the 19th century novel "Crime and Punishment":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crime_and_Punishment written by "Fyodor Dostoevsky":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fyodor_Dostoevsky.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]], [[parted bangs]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[heart tattoo]] on her [[chest tattoo|chest]]. She wears the uniform of all Limbus Company sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[black vest]], [[belt]], [[black pants]], [[black coat]], but excludes the [[red necktie]].

She wields an [[axe]] in her base identity, with the Russian word 'РАСКО́Л' ('SPLIT' In English) written on the head of the blade.

h4. Official art

* !post #5026015

title: kiana_kaslana_(knight_moonbeam)
body:
One of the playable [[official alternate costume|battlesuits]] of [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]'s [[Kiana Kaslana]]. 

The base Knight Moonbeam battlesuit is composed of a [[black leotard]] worn under a [[white dress]], [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]] worn alongside an inner layer of [[black gloves|black]], [[blue belt]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], [[black thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], [[white footwear|white]] [[thigh boots]], a [[cross hair ornament]], and white wing [[hair ornament]]s. 

She has two [[official alternate costume|alternate costume]] to the base battlesuit: her [[Kiana Kaslana (Lemon Soda)|Lemon Soda]] summer costume and [[Kiana Kaslana (Bastet's Secret)|Bastet's Secret]]. In addition, an alternate color-inverse version is used as a trial character for Chapter 6.

title: shirogane_tsumugi
body:
Character from [i][[Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony]][/i].

The Ultimate Cosplayer. She models for her homemade costumes out of obligation to her sponsors. She enjoys making her costumes more than wearing them, and would rather that someone who genuinely loves to cosplay or loves the character the costume is based on wear the outfits.

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her [[school uniform]] is a black [[blazer]] with matching [[pleated skirt]], and wears an [[orange_ribbon|orange]] [[ribbon]] on her shirt. She wears oval [[glasses]].

[spoiler]In Chapter 6, she is exposed as the mastermind behind the killing game.[/spoiler]

title: virus_(mega_man)
body:
A Virus is a malicious or corrupted program that disrupts the operating system or cyber network of electronic devices. Viruses are encountered as enemies in the [[Mega Man Battle Network (series)|Mega Man Battle Network series]], found randomly across the [[cyberspace]] (serving as an analogous of monster random encounters in many RPGs), searching for [[NetNavi|NetNavis]] and other programs to delete or mess with.
h4. See also
* [[em virus (mega man)| EM Virus]]

title: muv-luv
body:
A [[science fiction]] [[mecha]] video game by âge, the makers of [[Kimi ga Nozomu Eien]].

It starts as a dating sim, before switching the story's perspective towards an alternate universe where Earth has been devastated by an alien invasion. The first game is split into two parts, the first part ([i]MuvLuv Extra[/i]) is a high school romcom, while the second part ([i]MuvLuv Unlimited[/i]) introduces the science fiction and military focused alternate universe.

A manga adaptation of [i]Extra[/i] illustrated by [[Takao Ukyou]] and an adaptation of [i]Unlimited[/i] illustrated by [[Hirokawa Tomo]] were both released between 2004 and 2007.

body:

Sumika was voiced by [[Taguchi Hiroko]] up until the [[muv-luv alternative (anime)|Alternative anime adaptation]], where the role was transferred to [[Kusunoki Tomori]]. She's voiced by Lindsay Sheppard in [[Project MIKHAIL]]'s English dub.

body:

They wear [[red robe]]s, have a [[single tooth]], [[coke-bottle glasses|glasses with spirals]] and have propellers on their heads similar to [[Fly Guy]]s.

title: fly_guy
body:
[b]Fly Guys[/b], also just known as [b][[Shy Guy]]s[/b], are a variant of Shy Guy that have [[propeller]]s on their heads. Fly Guys have been used for various roles, most commonly to carry items, sometimes harmful things such as [[bomb]]s, or something to benefit the player, such as coins. The color of Fly Guy's [[propeller]] was originally yellow, but have also been white and are blue in recent appearances.

h4. Official art

* !post #6488598

title: rozzum_unit_7134
body: [b]ROZZUM unit 7134[/b], also known as [b]Roz[/b], is a [[non-humanoid robot|non-humanoid]] [[robot]] and a main character of Peter Brown’s novel [[The Wild Robot]] and its animated film adaptation of the same name from [[dreamworks|DreamWorks Animation]] and its parent [[Universal Studios]].

title: cackletta
body:
Main antagonist of [i][[Mario & Luigi: Superstar Saga]][/i] and its remake. A [[Beanish (mario)|]] witch from the Beanbean Kingdom. 

Disguising herself as [[Lady Lima]] to steal [[Princess Peach]]'s voice, she plans to use the stolen vocals to reawaken the [[Beanstar]] and have her evil wishes come true. 

[[Fawful]] is her loyal minion. 

h4. See also

* [[Cackletta Soul]]

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Cackletta":[https://www.mariowiki.com/Cackletta]

title: mario_&_luigi:_superstar_saga
body: [b]Mario & Luigi: Superstar Saga[/b] is a turn-based action RPG for the [[Game Boy Advance]], developed by AlphaDream and published by [[Nintendo]]. It was released in November of 2003 for the Game Boy Advance, and later as a Virtual Console title for the Wii U in April of 2014, and as one of the launch titles for Game Boy Advance - Nintendo Switch Online in February of 2023. The plot revolves around [[Mario]] and [[Luigi]] traveling to and exploring the Beanbag Kingdom to recover [[Princess Peach]]'s voice from an evil witch, [[Cackletta]], and her pupil, [[Fawful]].

title: general_guy
body: [b]General Guy[/b] is the leader of an [[shy guy|army of Shy Guys]] and the mastermind responsible for the numerous robberies in Toad Town during the events of Chapter 4 in [i][[paper mario 64|Paper Mario]][/I]. His main base of operations is the Shy Guy's Toy Box, where he rules the local Shy Guys and is in turn very loyal to [[Bowser]]. His army obeys him without question and he lauds them for their bravery, although his overconfidence in himself is proven unwarranted once he is defeated by Mario, leaving him screaming and fleeing in panic with the rest of the Shy Guys. He has a straightforward, formal and military-esque way of speaking in general, although at one point he childishly claims that [[Watt (paper mario)|]]'s attack is "too strong" and that Mario is cheating. He wears a peaked cap and gray robes decked with shoulder patches and a gold medal with a red ribbon on it.

title: fice_t_(paper_mario)
body:
[b]Fice T.[/b] is the nervous and neurotic guard of "Forever Forest":[https://www.mariowiki.com/Forever_Forest] in [i][[paper mario 64|Paper Mario]][/i]. His name is a pun on the word "feisty", but his personality is the exact opposite of feisty. He is "petrified of ghosts":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fear_of_ghosts], making him very inept for his guard position of "Forever Forest":[https://www.mariowiki.com/Forever_Forest]. The robe he wears and the spots on his cap are indigo and he carries a spear.

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Fice T.":[https://www.mariowiki.com/Fice_T.]

body:

title: popple_(mario)
body:
[i]"Oh, sure, [[mario|you]] [[luigi|guys]] are real tough, teaming up on me! Don't think you can beat me just 'cause I'm alone. It's my solo debut on the battle lines, see?"[/i]
     —[b]Popple[/b], [i]Mario & Luigi: Superstar Saga[/i]

[b]Popple[/b] is a supporting antagonist in [i][[Mario & Luigi: Superstar Saga]][/i], its Nintendo 3DS remake, and a supporting character in [i][[Mario & Luigi: Dream Team]][/i]. Popple, or the "Shadow Thief", as he calls himself, dreams of becoming a super thief and being rich beyond belief. He has a tendency of saying "see?" at the end of most sentences, a common verbal tic for stereotypical thugs and mobsters.

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Popple":[https://www.mariowiki.com/Popple]

[b]Goombella[/b] is a major character in [i][[Paper Mario: The Thousand Year Door]][/I], and its Nintendo Switch remake. Goombella is a smart and sassy but friendly [[Goomba]] and the first companion to join [[Mario]] on his quest. She provides tattle information to Mario about his location or the character who stands in front of him throughout his journey.

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Goombella":[https://www.mariowiki.com/Goombella]

title: monk_(ogiverse)
body:
Appearance of Buddhist monks in Jo Shin Ogi's paintings:
* Orange hair and orange eyes
* Large and round breasts
* Female
* Meditate and practice Buddhism on weekdays
But sometimes they will [[tribadism|scissoring]] with donors or another monk with orange hair and orange eyes like her.
Despite this, the image of Buddhist monks in Jo Shin Ogi's paintings is unified, and the color is unified in orange (the World Buddhist Association represents Dharma, solemnity, and wisdom. Mahayana Buddhism represents "forbearance").

title: plankton_(spongebob)
body:
[i]"Hear me, [[Mr. Krabs|Krabs]]! When I discover your formula for Krabby Patties, I’ll run you out of business! I went to college!"[/i]
— [i]PLANKTON'S FIRST LINES, IN THE EPISODE "PLANKTON!":[https://spongebob.fandom.com/wiki/Plankton!][/i]

[b]Sheldon J. Plankton[/b], most commonly known as [b]Plankton[/b], is one of the ten main characters of the [[Spongebob Squarepants (series)|]] series. He is a planktonic copepod who runs the Chum Bucket restaurant alongside [[Karen Plankton|Karen]], a waterproof computer who is his sidekick and wife. The Chum Bucket is highly unpopular in Bikini Bottom because it serves chum, a type of bait made from fish meat.

He is the central and main antagonist of the franchise. There are also several and many episodes in which Plankton acts as a sympathetic anti-hero. Plankton despises his rival, Mr. Krabs for running a successful restaurant because his own business rarely gets any customers. His main goal is to steal Krabs' secret formula for Krabby Patties and running Mr. Krabs out of business. Karen gives him a variety of plans to steal it, but their efforts always end up failing in the process.

h4. External links

* "Sheldon J. Plankton | Encyclopedia SpongeBobia | Fandom":[https://spongebob.fandom.com/wiki/Sheldon_J._Plankton]

title: king_bob-omb
body:
[b]King Bob-omb[/b] (formerly known as the [b]Big Bob-omb[/b]) is a character introduced in [[Super Mario 64]].

As his name suggests he is the King of the [[Bob-omb]]s, and a reoccurring boss character often closely allied with [[Bowser]]. [[Super Mario 64 DS]] and [[Mario & Luigi: Paper Jam]] implies that he looks down of those without mustaches.

He has a proud white [[mustache]], a gold [[crown]], wears [[white gloves]] and has [[yellow footwear|yellow]] [[pointy footwear|pointy shoes]]. Despite himself being a bomb, he lacks the winding key and fuse of his underlings.

title: greatest_freakout_ever
body:
"Greatest Freakout Ever" is a meme originating from a 2009 "YouTube video":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YersIyzsOpc] of the same name. In the video, Jack introduces himself to the camera and tells the viewers that his brother, Stephen, is freaking out because his [[World of Warcraft]] account was deleted by their mother. Jack then runs into Stephen's room to place the camera before running out just in time for [[stephen_quire|Stephen]] to storm in and start violently thrashing on his bed. He then gets tangled up in his blanket, threatening to "run away and never come back". After untangling himself from his blanket, he stands up, walks into his closet, and returns a few seconds later to thrash on his bed before he grabs a nearby TV remote and attempts to shove it up his butt. After that, he breaks down, smashing a shoe onto his head several times and continuing to thrash on the bed before his father yells offscreen for him to shut up. Finally coming down, he stands up, punches the bed, and calmly walks out. The last thing the viewer sees is Jack running in to retrieve the camera.

The moment where Stephen shoves the remote up his butt has become a focal point for fans of "Greatest Freakout Ever", with comments referencing it like "at least he didn't shove *insert item name* up his butt!"

title: class_of_09
body:
[b]Class of '09[/b] is an English-language visual novel that was originally released in June 2021. The story follows [[Nicole (class_of_09)|]], an American high school student navigating her junior year at her new school in 2008. A standalone visual novel called [b]Class of '09: The Re-Up[/b], was released on June 2023, which focuses on Nicole's senior year in 2009.

A spin-off called [b]Class of '09: The Flip Side[/b] released on 23 September 2024, mainly focusing on Nicole's best friend [[Jecka (class_of_09)|]], and their experiences post-graduation. In addition, a pilot episode for an anime adaptation was released on 14 December 2024.

The game is infamous for its adult themes and dark subject matter about being an American high school girl in the late 2000's.

h4. External Links
* "Class of '09 on Steam":[https://store.steampowered.com/app/1443200/Class_of_09/]

title: tsukimi_(kyata_ti666)
body:
Also known as: Mr. Rabbit, Bunnyhead.

Tsukimi's name is a pun on the word "月見" - "tsukimi" ("moon viewing"), alluding to him being a rabbit. Director of Sutegoro Inc.  Despite his position, no one takes him seriously because of his cute appearance and easygoing nature and is often the butt of many jokes as a result. Has a [[tsukimi's_wife_(kyata_ti666)| wife]] and [[momo_(kyata_ti666)| young daughter]].

title: toaster_oven
body:
A small countertop [[oven]] used for toasting like a [[toaster]] and limited baking.  This tag includes all ovens that'd be placed on the counter due to their visual similarity, this includes both toaster ovens and countertop regular style ovens .  Countertop regular ovens are the common type of oven in Japanese households due to space limitations preventing them from having a free-standing or wall oven unit.

There is some visual similarity between a toaster/countertop oven and a [[microwave]].  Visual differences include placement of a door handles, with oven handles being at the top with door opening downward and microwaves having handles on the side with the door usually opening to the side.  Ovens may feature metal racks inside of them, something microwaves can no have in them, while a microwave may have a glass carousel dish inside them to rotate items inside of them for even heating.

h4. Examples

* !post #1571736:  Toaster Oven
* !post #5225802:  Countertop Oven
* !post #4825907:  Microwave Oven
* !post #5571867:  Toaster Oven above Microwave Oven
* !post #5707881:  Toaster Oven on counter and Microwave above fridge

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Toaster - Toaster Oven":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toaster#Toaster_oven]
* "Wikipedia: Oven - Types":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oven#Types]

title: miles_g._morales
body:
Another version of [[Miles Morales]], from Earth-42 (as opposed to Miles' Earth-1610).

In his world, a certain radioactive spider was pulled through a portal and disappeared, preventing a Spider-Man from being born. Instead, when multiple supervillains came to rule over New York, he became an antihero vigilante dubbed [[prowler_(marvel)|The Prowler]].

title: akechi_gorou
body:
An investigator from [i][[Persona 5]][/i]. Voiced by [[Hoshi Souichirou]] (JP) / Robbie Daymond (EN).

He tries to track down the Phantom Thieves of Hearts, and especially their leader. He joins the party for a temporary time in the late game. As a party member, he goes under the codename Crow.

His persona is [[Robin Hood (Persona 5)|]], [spoiler]but later on his true Persona is revealed as [[Loki (Persona 5)|]].[/spoiler]

title: michaela_(evillious_nendaiki)
body:
Character from the [[Evillious Nendaiki]] and a side character of the [[Aku no Musume (series)|]] series. Portrayed by [[Hatsune Miku]].

"[i]A green woman from the neighboring country[/i], a maid with a beautiful singing voice. In early fanworks she was often mistakenly portrayed as a [[princess]]. [spoiler]She is a spirit from the Millennium Forest who took human form to help [[Elluka Clockworker]] in her quest for retrieve the [[Vessel of Sin|Vessels of Sin]]. She's a close friend of [[Gumillia]]. She takes the form of a blue [[bird|robin]] in spirit form, and made her human form based on [[Eve Moonlit]] after witnessing the events of [[moonlit bear (vocaloid)|]].[/spoiler]

[spoiler]In the second period, she was known as [[Lich Arklow]]'s younger brother Michael and was one of [[Levia barisol]]'s assistants. Michael Arklow was misread by [[Held Yggdra]] as "Michaela", leading to her gaining it as a nickname. She was engaged to Levia's other assistant [[Gumillia|Gumillia Matsumoto]]. Since she regained her memories of the Second Period and still chose to appear in her female form after the end of the world, she is considered to be a transgender woman.[/spoiler]

After being found by the outcast [[Clarith]], both girls grew close and eventually arrived to Aceid, the capital city of Elphegort, where they were hired by Freezis family, eventually meeting the King [[Kyle Marlon]]. This fateful encounter led to the invasion Lucifenia against Elphegort, in which she was killed by "a golden haired assassin". [spoiler]This is implied to be [[Allen Avadonia]], but is actually [[Ney Phutapie]].[/spoiler]

[spoilers]After her death, she was reincarnated as a tree and was chosen to succeed [[Held Yggdra|Held]] as the new Deity of the Millennium Forest.[/spoilers]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: lord_camelot_(fate)
body:
[[Mash Kyrielight]]'s [spoilers]and by extension [[Galahad (fate)|]]'s[/spoilers] large black shield. A shield made from the Round Table of Camelot where the [[Knights of the Round Table (fate)|]] would sit. It is capable of repelling attacks, so long as the user's willpower doesn't falter. It also grants its user and Master an anti-poison ward, and is the catalyst used for summoning Servants in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. In the Olympus Lostbelt, it gains an additional cannon-like weapon called the Black Barrel, which is capable of destroying gods.

It was originally designed to be [[Tachie (fate)|]]'s shield, but her character was scrapped from [[Fate/Stay Night]] and repurposed as Mash for FGO.

Not to be confused with the shield she wields in her [[Mash Kyrielight (Ortenaus)|Ortenaus]] form, [[Mold Camelot]].

h4.External Links

* "Lord Camelot on Type-Moon Wiki":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Lord_Camelot

title: pastry_bag
body:
Also called a piping bag, it is a handheld bag made from cloth or paper for piping semi-solid foods. It is filled through a wider opening at the opposite end, rolled or twisted closed, and then squeezed to extrude its contents. The most popular usage is for [[icing]], although pastries and garnishes can also be created this way.

h4.See also

* [[baking]]
* [[icing]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: needler
body: A covenant weapon from [[halo (series)|Halo]] that fires crystal needles. Each needle homes in on whatever living entity is closest when firing. These needles, when compounded enough, will generate a small explosion that usually kills the target.

title: ventilator_(medical)
body: A piece of medical equipment designed to assist a patient who has difficulty breathing, or, in extreme cases, cannot breathe on their own. Not to be confused with [[ventilator]], which is an apparatus to bring fresh air into a building, room, the interior of a ship, etc., or [[respirator]], a face mask intended to help the wearer breathe safely in hazardous atmospheric conditions.

title: ventilator
body: An apparatus to bring fresh air into an enclosed space, such as a building, room, or the interior of a ship. Often takes the form of a grille or grating on a wall.
